characters: THE WINDSHIELD IS RIDDLED WITH AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: A HEAVY CARGO FREIGHTER is moments from docking - and it' most beautiful scene ever as the sun's BRIGHT ORANGE RAYS through the center of the ship, across the smooth water.

dialogues.speaker: BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Someone is watching the ship closely as these private eye one end of the vessel to the other. The BUSY CREW prepare eminent dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The binoculars lower to reveal HARRY PHAN (50s), Chinese, thousand dollar suit and million dollar smile. Harry stan his custom Mercedes limousine. Out of the limo's backseat steps EDDIE STONE (50s), gray, hard as a rock. He speed dials a number on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (into cell) Move it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small security cubicle sits next to a sliding chain-lin aligned with barb wire. A heavy set GUARD pokes his head window as a PRIMO'S PIZZA DELIVERY VAN approaches.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Can I get your name, please?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I got an order for twelve large pepperonis. The guard checks his clipboard. The driver plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see you on the list.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Look, man. I don't know anything about who ordered what or none of that. I just deliver the pies. I was told to be here at exactly five forty five, on the dot. The guard checks a wall clock which reads 5:45PM and spot cargo ship approaching the docks. He gives the driver a h up, opens the gate. The van enters. INT. WAREHOUSE/HOLDING AREA вЂ” DUSK Several DOCK WORKERS and WAREHOUSE EMPLOYEES use forklift load and unload heavy crates and pallets into various cor Enter the PIZZA VAN. It parks in one of the busier areas. driver steps out as he's instantly approached by an un-am WAREHOUSE MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: The hell you think you're doing? This is a restricted area. The driver is really TERREL вЂњT-BONEвЂќ STIGGS (20s), th the creepiest red eyes you've ever seen. He pulls a forty -- presses it against the man's head.

dialogues.speaker: STIGGS
dialogues.text: To the back of the van. Make a sound and I blow your brains all over your shoes. Stiggs walks his hostage to the rear of the van.

dialogues.speaker: STIGGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open it. The manager opens the rear two doors of the van. Several MEN dressed as dock workers jump from the vehicle and cha room. All branding HIGH TECH AUTOMATIC WEAPONS. The men split in pairs of two, covering every corner. The quick and concise - professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one -- DOCK WORKERS are pulled from forklifts at gunpoint. -- TWO ARMED GUNMEN pass a large window and see an OFFICE behind his desk. They riddle the window with GUNFIRE as t clerk dives for cover.

dialogues.speaker: E./I. FRONT GATE/PIER 13
dialogues.text: Stiggs slowly walks up on the rear door of the security c as he charges in, draws down on the guard.

dialogues.speaker: STIGGS
dialogues.text: Shut your eyes. The guard squeezes them shut, like a scared child. Stiggs strikes him over the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large K-9 unit truck marked U.S. CUSTOMS SERVICE stops security window. Stiggs, now dressed as a security guard, his head through the open hole. The CUSTOMS AGENT greets him.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMS AGENT
dialogues.text: How're you doin' today?

dialogues.speaker: STIGGS
dialogues.text: Better than you. Stiggs points an MP5 ASSUALT WEAPON in the driver's windo unloads on the customs agent - blows pieces of him on the Stiggs cracks a toothy grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long STICK CRANE removes a steel shipping container fro ship, slowly lowers it to the pier. Watching from the gro is Harry Phan, Eddie Stone, and several of Harry's men. Harry is ear to ear smiles as he slowly puffs away at a cigarette. Just as the ship container touches the docks, Eddie give heads up to four of the men. All armed and toting heavy backpacks. The men hump it up the gangway and into the vessel. INT. WAREHOUSE/HOLDING AREA вЂ” DUSK A flat nosed TOWING RIG hauls in the steel shipping conta taken from the ship. It parks with the rear end facing Ha and his gunmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's men strategically place their backpacks on the oi scum ridden floor. Fuel gauges, switches and meters cover room from ground to ceiling. INT. WAREHOUSE/HOLDING AREA вЂ” DUSK Harry, Eddie and the others watch as one of the gunmen un the locking mechanism from the rear of the container -- s open the doors. Harry watches as two of his men use tire irons to pry ope wooden crate. Dozens of boxes marked in Chinese writing a stacked one on top of the other. Harry opens one of the boxes and pulls out a cylinder sha can of dry cereal. He pops off the lid and pours the cere over the other cases. Small plastic baggies of CRYSTAL ME drop from the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large semi truck and trailer backs into the open dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forklift finishes loading the last of the wooden crates the back of the trailer. Harry watches as his men hook and lock the back of the se trailer. They are fast, precise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, standing by the limo, gives the go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie) It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Harry's men responds to Eddie's call through a two walkie.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY'S MAN
dialogues.text: Roger. He throws up a hand signal to the other three men. In uni the other men reach into their bags and start a digital t 10:59, 10:58, 10:57... All four men quickly retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry joins Eddie in the back of the limo as the Mercedes away, leaving the pizza delivery van on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages are lined up like ducks in a row. All with t hands on their heads. Five gunmen draw down on them with automatic weapons, watching them like hawks. Stiggs unhooks an empty shipping container as the hostage forced inside, one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: STIGGS
dialogues.text: Let's go! Move it! Stiggs shoves the last of the hostages inside and quickly them up. Stiggs and the rest of Harry's team retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stiggs and his team load into the back of the pizza deliv as it speeds from the docks and out the front gate. The CARGO SHIP ERUPTS IN A GIANT BLAZE OF FIRE. The force of the explosion is so strong it shoots the fla hundred feet into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black Hummer twists its way up a steep and winding driv The surrounding foliage is green and full of life. A beau sight. Harry's posh mansion hides behind some shrubbery. The Hummer circles a giant water fountain. A culdesac lea them to the front of the home. Out steps -- Eddie Stone and two more men. From the front seat steps D RIVIERA (30s), Cuban-American, sharply dressed, trim bear From the back steps his partner HAL BENSON (40s), aged, w weary, dark, tired eyes, sloppy. And these men are two of LAPD's not-so-finest. Benson and Diego stare at the grounds in a state of awe. are both reluctant to follow Stone's lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Benson and Diego hover over the balcony rail, star at a hopping pool party with several twenty-somethings, y men and women, swimming, sunbathing, drinking.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They were street urchins when I found them. Lost, angry souls. No family, no job. Nothing to live for. Disposed of by society. You find someone like this. Feed them. Cloth them. Give them shelter. Provide them with means beyond their wildest imagination. Along with a steady supply of whatever poison they're polluting their bodies with...and they become loyal as lapdogs. Diego observes the crowd - unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I don't know. They don't look so dangerous to me.  Harry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come. I have something to show you. Harry leads the men back inside - as they pass a heated g pool between two hot bikinis, one of which is smoking met a glass pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a dozen of Harry's strays are firing pistols and au weapons at paper targets. Young men and women. Harry walks Diego and Benson down the line.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: As you can see, it's not all fun and games. There's a small price to pay for sitting in the lap of luxury. I keep my soldiers sharp. All highly trained, highly skilled in whatever mission I see fit. Benson peeks through some venetian blinds at a whole couc of YOUNG WOMEN in thousand dollar gowns, lined up in a ro taking turns going down on one of Harry's goons. A specia of training. Harry leads the two men onto an outside deck with a full a stone fire pit, leather chairs, swank couches. He pours the men a shot of scotch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm building an empire. Soldiers loyal to me. Ready to carry out my vision. To follow orders... without question. He hands Benson and Diego their drinks, as the partners s quick look.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me where you can find that kind of loyalty in your police department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you gentlemen come in. As I said, I've been spoiling them far too much. The problem with kids...you spoil them...they get greedy. And they get sloppy. Go into business for themselves. And then they get caught. I can't have my name mentioned every time one of my people get busted slinging dime bags to school kids.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: What do you want from us? Harry grabs two manila files from the bar's surface, hand to Diego and Benson.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I need certain people off the street. Mister Stone tells me you're the men for the job. Diego peeks into a rear window and watches as one of the of the evening drops her evening gown to the carpet and unbuttons her bra. Harry steps closer to Diego, grabs his attention.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've compiled some lists for you men. The names on these lists have become a serious problem for me. I need you to dig up their records. Find any means necessary to make the charges stick. Diego opens his file and takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You want us to frame up every name on this list?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You don't understand, Detective. I'm not asking you to arrest them.  Diego checks with his partner, who is just as unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young thug in black tank-top, wild swim trunks and jail tats, wanders back and forth at a corner stop sign. This

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY, (22)
dialogues.text: Anthony uses an ipod to pass the time. Just a few feet fr him, parked at a curb, is his black PORSCHE BOXSTER. He greets another young SURFER TYPE and his GIRL with a q hand shake and a hug. A dope deal. Anthony plays an air drum solo just as Harry's limousine up from behind. Anthony spots it, books it up the sidewal Eddie Stone and Stiggs step from the backseat. They chase Anthony, who is caught by two more of Harry's soldiers. SOLDIER #1 forces him to the ground and pulls CAR KEYS fr pants pocket, throws them to Stone. Stone and SOLDIER #2 head for Anthony's PORSCHE while Sti SOLDIER #1 escort Anthony to the limo, toss him in the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stiggs and Harry's Soldier on each side of Anthony, watch like a hawk. Anthony scared for his life as he spots the visible face of Harry Phan across from him. Harry leans in closer, holds a cigar in one hand, a scotc the other.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hello, Anthony. How's business? Anthony stalls, sweats guilt like a stuck pig.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Great, Mister Phan. I've just been out here, generating some business for you. You know how it is.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So... on top of stealing from me, you're insulting my intelligence.  10

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: (begs) It's not like that. Harry, please. Stiggs flips open a switchblade, rubs it up and down Anth neck.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We had a deal, Anthony. I gave you everything. A roof, money, pleasures well beyond your means. All I've asked for in return is your loyalty. When I trust you with my business, I trust you with my life.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Please, Harry. You can trust me. I just lost my head for a minute. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm afraid your word isn't good enough. If I'm to trust you with my life...I'll need reassurance. Stiggs cracks an evil grin. Anthony notices.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hear you and Lisa are quite the item these days.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Hey, man. Don't hurt her. Please.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Your associate Mister Degrassi has refused a sit down. On top of this, you've been using my product to help your goomba friends bankroll their filth. You're involvement with this man has all but painted a target on my back for the police. (dead serious) I told you what would happen if you crossed me. Didn't I? Anthony's chest heaves, sweats like crazy, beyond scared.  11

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You took what was most important to me. The way I see it, Anthony, there's only one way to make things right between us.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever you want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK DEGRASSI (30s), a real grease ball with slicked back and a silk shirt with palm trees, leans in his swivel cha feet kicked up on his desk, balances a pencil on his nose In walks his busty secretary TIFFANY (20s)

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Nick. A Lisa Huber is here for you. Nick doesn't budge from his relaxed position.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Tell her I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY
dialogues.text: She says she's a friend of Tony's. That you're expecting her. Nick quickly sits up, the pencil spills to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She's one of Tony's girls, huh? Send her in. Nick squirts some breath spray as Tiffany steps out and s the door behind her. In walks LISA HUBER (20s), thin, malnutrition-ed, pale, b dolled up for her audition. She's the girl next door type a pair of legs that go all the way up. Nick sizes her up. He cracks a small grin.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So. Tony tells me you're very talented.  12 Lisa awkwardly crosses her arms, covering her exposed cle

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So tell me something, Teresa. Just how talented are you?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Actually, it's Lisa. And I'm not real sure I know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just bet you don't. But I'm hip. You like to play the clueless schoolgirl routine, twirling your little hair, acting all lost and helpless. Nick bounces in his chair, nodding, biting his bottom lip look of pure lust across his face.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I bet you do that to all the boys, don't you? Lisa looks increasingly uncomfortable as Nick's creepy st burns a hole in her chest.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Isn't there a script or something? Nick smiles as he pushes away from his desk, wheels his c into the open and unbuttons his fly.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nah. Consider this more of an oral interview. Lisa's eyes twitch, lips quiver with hate. She clumsily p silenced TWENTY-TWO from her purse and FIRES THREE SHOTS Nick's chest.

dialogues.speaker: I./E. NICK'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Lisa quickly exits, anxious, sweating. The outside waitin is wall to wall with nubile young women, all dressed to k putting on makeup and doing their hair.  13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa storms into the staircase with her purse dangling fr arm, breathing hard, running for her life. She almost run TWO HOTTIES coming up the steps. She pushes straight through them. They turn and stare, pi off, ready to scrap.

dialogues.speaker: HOTTIE
dialogues.text: Check the fucking yield sign!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa runs into the street, cell phone in hand, still brea hard, staring in both directions.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Tony, where the hell are you?! Lisa spots Tony's familiar PORSCHE BOXSTER creeping aroun corner as she smiles in relief. And all of a sudden... The Porsche SQUEALS ITS TIRES, barrels toward Lisa at a c speed as her smile turns to sheer panic. Pow! The force of the collision sends Lisa tumbling over the r the car, crashing onto the asphalt. The Porsche speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche Boxster rushes into the busy parking lot of t posh, high class eatery, stops near a young VALET. Out of the Porsche steps Eddie Stone and one of Harry's m back from their mission. Stone hands the CAR KEYS to the VALET, who quickly parks Porsche in an empty spot near the front.  14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony hovers over Harry as he sits in a private, reserv near the kitchen, finishes his meal with a swig of Saki. Stiggs and some of Harry's crew have joined him for lunch they sip beers and watch a sniveling Anthony beg, grovel forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: So, that's it? We're square? Harry wipes his mouth with a linen napkin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: For now. Anthony checks with Stiggs, who is ear to ear smiles. He' bit unsure as he slowly backs toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Like I said, I'll make it up to you. Whatever you need, I'm yours.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Of course. Because without trust, what do we have? Wouldn't you agree?

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Of course. Anthony finally turns, hurries for the front door. Harry, Stiggs and the other men share a smile. They know little something Anthony doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony waits by the door as the VALET pulls his Porsche front. The Valet jumps out as an anxious Anthony crawls in and s the door.  15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony notices his glove box is open and a LOADED GUN re inside.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: What the hell...? Anthony grabs the weapon, gives it a once over. Before he knows what's going on -- BENSON and DIEGO draw down on him with TWELVE GAUGE SHOTG

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Police! Turn off the engine and step out of the car!

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Diego covers the passenger side as Benson moves for the d window.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Drop it! Anthony panics and fires through the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: The shots miss Diego by a mile as he and Benson unload ro after round from their SHOTGUNS. Benson and Diego empty their weapons into the Porsche, BL SHARDS OF GLASS ALL OVER THE PAVEMENT. They observe Anthony's body, and then each other. There's of shame and regret on their faces as a THICK SMOKE still in the air. And then -- The METALLIC HUM of a familiar SONG begins to build in th as the two cops observe their handy work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: вЂњTHE HEAT IS ONвЂќ bursts onto the screen along with a PONTIAC GTO CONVERTIBLE. Behind the wheel is none other than AXEL FOLEY (50s), bla suit with white stripes, matching hat and dark shades. Axel rests an arm on the side of his door as he cruises t down district of Highland Park. TITLE CARD: вЂњBEVERLY HILLS COPSвЂќ ROLL CREDITS as we observe --вЂ” -- A DRUNK on the street. -- KIDS on a basketball court. One body checks the other fight ensues. -- A HOOKER at the point, making a date. She pulls out a wedgie from her mini-skirt, pokes her head in a car windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel's GTO pulls a quick u-turn, parks against a curb out this dingy, sketchy looking joint. Out steps Axel in his but flashy pimp get-up. As he struts his way to the door George Jefferson style, of hooligans swarm around his ride, one with a basketball his arm, fresh off the court. HOOLIGAN #1 uses a tape measure on his front left RIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In walks Axel, as the unimpressed, dressed down crowd tur stare at the clown suit by the door. вЂњOhio PlayersвЂќ b the juke. A thick SMOKE lingers in the air. Axel twirls a tooth pick in his mouth, observes the smoke room of thugs, low-lives and hookers. The girls, gathered bar, painted up, weaves and wigs, texting, chewing gum, b Other locals shoot stick, play cards, swill beers.  17 Axel feels their contempt as he makes his way through the and to a corner booth where he meets with -- RUDY VALENTINE (40s), wannabe thug, hooded jump suit, smo philly blunt, a chubby heart attack waiting to happen. Rudy nearly jumps from his seat as Axel approaches, clums anxious. He shakes his hand, throws him a hug.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Yo, Boogie Ray, what's up, brother? Lookin' good. Axel jerks away.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: First of all...don't touch the suit! Second, never mind that shit! Third, where the girls at?!

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Be cool, brother. They just runnin' a little late, that's all. Have a seat and relax.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I ain't got time to relax. I'll relax when I get home. Right now, I'm workin'. I'm doin' business, and from where I'm standin', you ain't ready for business, and you're wastin' my fuckin' time. So fuck you and good night. Axel turns to leave. Rudy chases him down.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I can get em here in five minutes. They just a phone call away.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Hey, man. I know bullshit when I smell it, okay? You said ten o'clock and the girls would be here. I see bitches at the bar, bitches playin' pool, and you in the corner like you sittin' in the no pussy section. Time is money and you costin' me money. I'm outta here.  18 Once again, Axel races for the door and Rudy grabs his ar

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Look, I said they'll be here, okay, now settle down and have a seat. I got you a Hennessey and coke. Axel stares down at Rudy's hand on his arm. Rudy backs of

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Don't have me standin' around...like an asshole! I got business to take care of! You don't want my business, I'll take my big ass bag of money elsewhere! The crowd all take notice, turn and stare at Axel and Rud Rudy grows nervous.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I won't man. Now sit down and shut up for a second. Alright? Axel heads to the booth. Rudy takes a seat across from hi

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I can get her here in five minutes. Just cool out.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What's this her, bullshit? I said girls! As in two very specific girls! A redhead and a mulatto! The word on the street was you were the man to talk to! You better not be goin' back on our deal! Like you fuckin' with Johnny the banana man here!

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Okay, it's like this. The redhead's down. She's a pro, been workin' the street for five years, ready for business. But her friend, she's new to the life. She's a little unsure, but said if the money's right, she's ready to talk. Axel gives him an unsure look. A slight grin.  19

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Cut the bullshit. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: So it's like this, brother. Money talks and bullshit walks. You show me the green and I'll make the call. I can get em here in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Ten minutes? What happened to five?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Look, you wanna do business or not? Axel pulls a brown envelope from his suit pocket, hands i the table to Rudy, who fans it out, gives it a look.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit tight. I'll be back. Rudy jumps for the table, heads for the door as Axel make the men's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel locks himself in a stall, speed dials a number on hi as he nervously peeks through the cracks.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, it's me. Are you sitting down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel's client KENAN MARCUS (50s), black, ex con, a striki large, but tired looking man slowly takes a seat on his c A very worried look shoots across his face.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: I am now. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I found her. Kenan shuts his eyes in peaceful relief.  20

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: Don't mess with me, Axel. Not now. Kenan grips an old family photo of him, his blonde wife a gorgeous daughter LOLA MARCUS (14), big green eyes, perfe smile, mulatto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel still in the bathroom stall as he peeks through the cracks of the door.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'm not. My guy on the street says she's cribbing with a girlfriend at this guy Rudy Valentine's house. Rudy just confirmed it about two minutes ago. She's on her way.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: She's meeting you there?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Now, look. I don't want you coming down here and scaring them off. You can see her soon enough, but I'm gonna need at least a couple hours.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: She's in trouble, isn't she? Forget it. I'm comin' down there.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Look. Didn't I say you need to trust me on this? Trust me. You comin down here is a real bad idea. Sit tight and you guys will be together soon enough. Right now, I need a couple hours to get this deal done. Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenan, still staring at the photo, wanders back and forth living room carpet, a tear in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: KENAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright. But nothing...I mean nothing better happen to her, Foley.  21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel comes back from his trip to the men's room and spots MARCUS (21), all grown up, beautiful, and friend REENA O' (20s), redhead, big hair, covered in freckles and tatts. The two friends remove their coats and take a seat at the table where Rudy and Axel were sitting. Rudy is nowhere t found. Axel surveys the room. He checks the front door and spots quickly making his way out just as --

dialogues.speaker: TWO MASKED MEN
dialogues.text: -- enter and pull two silenced UZIS from their trench coa aim straight for Axel. Axel runs, leaps behind the bar, just as the Masked Men u round after round in his direction. The bottles behind the bar EXPLODE as bullets rip them to and patrons dive for cover. MASKED MAN #1 hurries over to LOLA and REENA, cowering in seats, hands over their heads. The shooter removes his mask. It's none other than TERREL STIGGS. Lola stares up at him just as Stiggs drops and re a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: MASKED MAN
dialogues.text: Come on, man! Hurry up! Lola and Reena make a run for the door. Axel pops up from behind the bar and takes a few shots at as he tips over a table, uses it as cover. Masked Man #2 returns Axel's fire as he cowers behind the Stiggs spots Lola and Reena making for the door. He cocks weapon, riddles them both with bullets. The two girls fall to the floor. A bloody mess. Stiggs an partner retreat out the door. Axel's head pops up from be the bar, gets a closer look at Stiggs.  22 Axel leaps over the railing, runs to the two girls on the bleeding, dying. Lola's dead eyes stare back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel leans against his GTO, holds a rag against his blood as he watches the CORONER load Lola into a meat wagon. UNIFORM COPS question several patrons looming around outs the lead investigator, DETECTIVE MORRIS (40s) curly hair, and pudgy, takes a statement from a HOOKER with orange ha a leopard dress. He obnoxiously snaps at his gum as he approaches Axel.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: You know, Foley, I thought we were all done with you for good. Guess I should know better by now.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess you should.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: So who were those two girls? No, wait. Let me guess. New business associates of yours?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: My head's fine. Thanks for asking.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Well I got some news for you, smartass. We got two workin' girls here. And whoever hit em went after you first. Judging by the way you're dressed, one might get the wrong idea.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: The black girl's Lola Marcus. Her old man just finished a ten year stint at Jackson for armed robbery. After a few hundred phone calls and letters to his daughter go unanswered, he hired me to find her. Morris shakes his head with disgust.  23

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: This Lola finds out her old man is getting out of the joint and goes into hiding. Next thing you know someone tries to burn all three of you. Pretty wild coincidence don't you think? Axel gives him a dirty look and takes a stroll up the sid

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking and you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Am I? He was an ex con, right?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I know this guy. There's no way he had anything to do with it. All he wanted for the last ten years was a chance to see his baby girl again. Axel watches with sincere sadness and regret as the coron van pulls away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now he gets to identify her at the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Okay, smart guy, so who was it then? Axel faces him.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Rudy Valentine. (beat) A couple weeks back, Lola hooks up with the redhead and the two of them move in with redhead's sister at her boyfriend's house. That's Rudy. I put the word out I was lookin' for a couple of girls and cut a deal with him.  Axel just 24

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean...'is that it'? What else do you need? It's obvious whoever wanted Lola dead knew I was lookin' for her. They pay Rudy to turn the other cheek and set all three of us up.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: That's great, but it doesn't answer the million dollar question. Why did they want you?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Who knows? I've been doin' some asking around about Lola. Maybe they fingered me as a cop.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well I got news for you, Foley. You're not a cop anymore. So do us all a favor and stay out of this one. smiles and walks off. Morris follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you're thinking about goin' after Valentine, you can forget it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Cos he's dead. Axel stops in his tracks, faces Morris.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Cops just found him at a stoplight with his engine running and his throat slit. This Lola girl sounds like she was running with a real nice crowd, huh?  25

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Look, this girl's father is a friend of mine. Whatever she was into, he needs to hear it from me first. Morris observes Axel's face. An unsure look.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Stay out of this case.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Look, he trusted me to find out what was goin on with his daughter and to bring her home. I don't know if you noticed, but she died on my watch. Morris stalls. He finally cracks.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS
dialogues.text: Okay, Foley. Fine. It's not like we have much to go on. Morris opens up a file on Lola Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reads) Lola Marcus, twenty-one. Last known address, 426 Lincoln Avenue, Detroit. It looks like the last six months are clean. September of last year, she's busted on a possession charge in L.A. It appears your girl spent some time out there. Between April and September, she racked up over four thousand bucks in parking and traffic citations. Like I said, after September she went off the grid. We got nothing on her. Morris shuts the file.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. Now you know as much as we do. Axel nods and heads to his car.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Foley! Stay outta this one!  26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surrounding palm trees stand tall and proud as they r in the cool, midday breeze. OFFICERS and CITY WORKERS fil and out of the building as a lone figure is seen racing u tall front steps. This is -- LT. WILLIAM вЂњBILLYвЂќ ROSEWOOD, I.A.D. (55), tuxedo, un collar and loose bow tie. He's toting a heavy stack of fi as he rushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A visibly annoyed Detective BENSON sits before a small In Affairs review board committee, headed by ROSEWOOD and fo by -- LT. WEINBERG (40s), a short, elfish man, with black wire- glasses too large for his thin face, and -- SGT. VAUGHN (40s), an intense looking woman in a black bu suit and jet black hair pulled in a tight bun.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: According to your report, Detective, you first noticed the suspect reach for his weapon upon entering the parking lot of Lao Chen's restaurant. (beat) But your partner maintains that your suspect didn't make a move for his gun until after you approached the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, that's what I meant. As we were pulling in, I saw what looked like him popping the glove box, and when my partner and I stepped out... that's when he went for his piece. Weinberg checks with Vaughn who nods with approval.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Thank you, Detective. That'll be all for now.  27 Weinberg offers an insincere smile as Rosewood looks read jump out of his seat with impatience.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's not all.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: You have something else for Detective Benson?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I was just curious about something, Benson.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Shoot. Lt. Vaughn is put off by Benson's flippant attitude.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. Poor choice of words.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Well, I was wondering whether it was you or Riveira who decided on that particular parking lot to detain your suspect.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: What're you getting at?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: It's a simple question.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Neither. We ran the tag and hit the lights. The suspect pulled into the lot and we followed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's interesting. I guess you didn't know that Anthony LaRussa worked at Lao Chen's as a full time waiter?

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: No, I guess I didn't. It's my first time hearing of it. Is there a point to any of this?  28 Weinberg looks increasingly annoyed by this line of quest He huffs under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: If there aren't any more questions for the Detective, I think this would be a good place to end.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Just one more question. Weinberg and Vaughn roll their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of Phan Enterprises? This catches Benson's attention. He stays strangely quiet avoids eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Okay. I think that's enough for today. Thanks for coming in, Detective. Benson just smiles at Rosewood as he slowly stands.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Yeah. No problem. Let's do it again sometime. Benson heads out. Rosewood shakes his head with contempt the officer as he watches him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosewood and Weinberg walk side by side toward an elevato neither look very happy with one another.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: That was great, Rosewood. Very subtle. Bill Rosewood, caped crusader of all things corrupt. Vice cops running a ring of homeless dealers and prostitutes? Weinberg chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought I heard it all before.  29

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: The eyes never lie.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: His eyes. You see how he reacted when I mentioned Phan's name?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Probably because he didn't know what the hell you were talking about. For weeks you been after this Harry Phan character, and for what? All you got is the word of one cracked up hooker lookin' to get over on a cop.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: A hooker who happened to disappear. The two men enter an elevator. The doors shut behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosewood, now super annoyed, stares straight ahead, ignor pestering co-worker.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: So what now? You gonna take on the whole force every time a bust goes sideways and some delinquent turns up dead?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: If I have to.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. (beat) Do yourself a favor and give it up. Give it up before you lose what little credibility you have left. The doors open, off steps Weinberg, leaving a pitiful loo Rosewood to ponder it all.  30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big crowd is making their way in as a couple of GROOMSM tuxes stand at the doors and greet friends and family. A picture frame rests on an easel. The names JOHN TAGGERT and JORDAN TAYLOR are featured ele behind the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The groom stands before a sliding mirror door, fixes his runs a couple fingers through his hair. This is JOHN TAGGERT, JR. (20s), shaggy, strawberry blond handsome, and strikes a similar resemblance to his old ma not for a neatly trimmed goatee.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: If only your mother could see you. This voice belongs to none other than JOHN TAGGERT, SR. ( aged, tired eyes, and a bit grayer than we've seen before

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You're not gonna make me start crying, are you, pop? That's the bride's job.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: You know that was her one regret. Not being able to see this day. And to think...I almost missed it. Johnny isn't happy with his tie, starts over, a bit nervo say the least.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Well, you're here now. Nothing else matters.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: It does matter. I was supposed to be the strong one. The one that held us all together. Taggert intervenes, helps tie Johnny's knot.  31

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess after your Mom passed...I wasn't sure how to handle things. It had been so long since I had to be a father. It made me realize something.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I wasn't such a great father to you growing up. I let your mother handle things at home while I was running around the streets like a kid. Taggert shakes his head with regret, misty eyed.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you still resent me for that. And I'm sorry. But I just want you to know that I'm back. And I'm not going anywhere. If it's okay with you...I wanna start over. Taggert finishes the knot. Johnny smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Sure, pop. Johnny gives his old man a long, overdue hug. In walks Ro with a concerned look on his face. Taggert and Johnny bot quickly wiping their tears.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Hey. We got less than ten minutes and we're still missing a best man.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Well go find him, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I know where he is. In the bathroom. I think he's sick or something. He went in there ten minutes ago and won't come out. This scares Johnny as he races for the door.  32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind a bathroom stall, smoking crystal meth from a glas is RICKY JARVIS (20s), sweaty, anxious, a real mess. His forehead and unbuttoned shirt are soaked. Ricky takes another monster hit and COUGHS out loud. He l his head against the stall door, squeezes his eyes shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In runs a worried Johnny as he pushes in each of the stal in search of Ricky. He finds him - pulls him from the stall by his shirt coll throws him against the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? You can't stop for a few hours? Johnny feels a strange bulge behind Ricky's tux jacket an out a thirty eight special.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're packing? What's the matter with you? Bringing a gun to my wedding?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: They know, man! They know! That broad at The Pit Stop! The one I told you about! She knew it was me!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You're being paranoid. It's all that shit you're smokinвЂ™.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Nah, man! It's that guy! It's that fuckin' guy with the eyes! He's been following me! I seen him all week! They know! They know, man! Johnny clasps his hand over Ricky's mouth, keeps him quie keeps a close eye on the door.  33

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You're gonna pull yourself together and get through the next couple of hours without embarrassing me. You got it? Johnny lets go of his mouth, opens the chamber on the thi eight and empties the shells. Johnny observes what a mess his buddy is. His tie loose, undone and soaked with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clean yourself up, man. Everyone's waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny and his bride to be stand side by side before a MI while Ricky, Rosewood and the other GROOMSMEN watch on. Taggert sits in the first row and exchanges a cordial smi JORDAN'S MOTHER AND FATHER across the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: Dearly Beloved: We are gathered here, in the presence of God and of this company, that John Taggert and Jordan Taylor may be united in holy matrimony. We are here to celebrate and share in the glorious act that God is about to perform - the act by which He converts their love for one another into the holy and sacred estate of marriage... And through the rear two doors struts AXEL in a leather j jeans and sloppy sweatshirt. Rosewood catches a glimpse of Axel out of the corner of h and does a double-take.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: You disagree?  34 The entire congregation, including Taggert, turn and star at Axel looming at the double doors. Taggert shuts his tired eyes and rubs the bridge of his n he slumps in defeat. Axel just smiles back at the curious crowd.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: How ya doin'?! Carry on! Axel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jordan's arm around husband Johnny as she swipes a handfu wedding cake frosting and smears his face. The crowd erup with laughter. Taggert, Axel and Rosewood sip some punch the corner.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: You still know how to make an entrance, Foley.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, sorry I was late, but my invitation must've got lost in the mail.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Hey. Even I didn't know about this wedding until a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I guess you could say I've been MIA for awhile. It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (to Axel) Speaking of...where the hell have you been? I tried to call you at least a dozen times the last couple years. No one down at the station even knew who you were.  35

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I've been MIA for awhile. Taggert and Rosewood share a not so surprised smile.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a long story. Axel's trademark laugh.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: So what're you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm working a case.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Why am I not surprised? The answer's no, Axel.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You ain't even heard what I gotta say.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's right. And I wanna keep it that way while I can still hold on to my job. Axel rests his hand on Rosewood's forehead, playfully che temperature.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Who are you? What have you done with Rosewood?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Billy's IAD now, Axel. Axel is taken aback. He hides a grin.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's right. It means I can't start World War III in the street every time you're in town. I'm happy to see you and all, but do me the favor of keeping me out of it.  36 Rosewood walks off. Axel is confused while Taggert shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Is he serious?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so. The banging of a knife on a champagne flute grabs everyon attention. Axel and Taggert watch as Ricky grabs a mic an steps to the center of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: It's about that time. Time for me to say something nice about the bride and groom. As both John and Jordan already know...I've never been very good in front of crowds. But because of them... and their love and support...I'm alive today and blessed to still have the opportunity talk to big crowds like you. To share my story to people who are struggling every day with drug and alcohol abuse. (to John and Jordan) People in dying need of that same love and support you've given me. I feel grateful to be alive today to pay those same blessings forward. Ricky is obviously high as John and Jordan can barely wat toast. They sport a fake smile for the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (whispers) What was he doin' in that bathroom anyways? An embarrassed Taggert shooshes him.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I don't wanna take up too much time away from you guys. After all, this is your show. But I just wanna say one more thing. Ricky is distracted by STIGGS standing at the front door.  37 Axel follows his look to the door, but Stiggs is now gone crowd observes Ricky's unusual behavior.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanna say that... Ricky checks the other side of the room for Stiggs. His f moves through a crowd gathered near the punch table. Axel and Taggert follow his look toward the punch table a recognizes the evil, familiar face of Stiggs smiling at R

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Taggert squints in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (to crowd) Excuse me. Ricky drops the mic to the floor and books it for the fro as the crowd erupts with chatter. Johnny quickly stands - surveys the room for Stiggs. Axel watches on as Stiggs races out the opposite door in of Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (to Taggert) Excuse me. Axel takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky bursts through the front doors of this massive chur he charges down the steps with a purpose. He stops dead i tracks as he spots --  38 A green BOSS 302 screaming around the corner with a MACHI dangling from the passenger window. Ricky leaps behind some bushes to avoid being shot by the just as Axel runs out a side door. The BOSS 302 brakes in front of the church steps. The GUNMAN open fires in Ricky's direction as a bullet pa through the shrubs and strikes him in the left arm. Both Johnny and Jordan run out the front door as Jordan a trips on her dress. A stray bullet tears through her slee Johnny tackles her to the ground. Axel charges down a glassy slope and stops on a sidewalk behind the car's rear windshield. He takes aim:

dialogues.speaker: POW-POW-POW
dialogues.text: The three shots SHATTER THE REAR WINDSHIELD as the flashy speeds off. Axel runs up the church steps just as Stiggs hovers over still hiding behind the shrubbery. Stiggs smiles and takes aim. Ricky squeezes his eyes shut curls up like a baby. Axel takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Hey! Stiggs aims and fires just as Axel dives for cover behind cement wall. Stiggs turns back to Ricky - but he's long g Axel peeks around the corner of the wall - notices both S and Ricky are gone.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH STEPS
dialogues.text: The FLASHING RED AND BLUE LIGHTS of SQUAD CARS are parked base of the steps as Rosewood gives his statement to an o DETECTIVE. Axel and Taggert rest on the top step as they watch the h mad bride pace back and forth, give Johnny crap.  39

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: What did I say about him being in the wedding?! Johnny rolls his eyes and rubs his sore temples.

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's because of this shit! Once a junky always a junky! He's supposed to be your friend and he can't give you just one day?!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Look, there's more to it than that, okay? You don't know the whole story. Taggert quickly turns, faces his son.

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: There's always a story with Ricky! I don't wanna hear it! Not today! (beat) This wasn't supposed to be like this! We're supposed to look back on today as the greatest day of our life! Now every time we look at our wedding pictures, they'll say 'hey...that's a real beautiful dress! Besides that huge fucking bullet hole ripped in the sleeve!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: This wasn't his fault! Taggert quickly stands - interrupts their shouting match.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? Johnny hugs his hips and turns his back on his dad.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know something about this? If you know something, you better tell me.  40

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: It's complicated. It wasn't supposed to go down like this.

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: What wasn't supposed to go down like this? Axel joins them.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: If you know who those guys are, you need to say so.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I don't know who they are. I just heard stories. Ricky won't tell me. He's scared to death of him.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Him? Who's him? Rosewood joins the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Before Ricky got clean, he used to sling dope for this guy. He found him trying to boost his car, and instead of turning him in to the cops, he offers him a briefcase full of cash to go work for him. (beat) At least that's the story he gave me.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What's his name? Johnny gives Rosewood a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I told you, I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: More importantly...what's this got to do with you? Johnny remains strangely quiet as he paces back and forth  41

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well...?

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: Answer him!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: The Super Bowl, Dad. It cleaned me out. Jordan and my nest egg. Our down payment on the house, our honey moon. Everything. Gone. Jordan's jaw drops. Taggert gives his son a look of true utter disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: Come again?! You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I thought you were done with that.

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, so did I!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Ricky came up with this idea to get it all back. I told him I wasn't interested, but you know when Ricky gets an idea in his head, you can't stop him --

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (interrupts) It's too late for all that now. The damage is done.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: He said he was gonna hit this place they call 'The Pit Stop'.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That gas station on Mulholland?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Right. This guy he worked for. He uses it as a front to run drugs and whores. Takes in anywhere from ten to twenty grand a night. In cash.  42

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's the kind of money nobody reports stolen.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (angry) Yeah, well, somebody noticed it was missing, didn't they? Johnny hangs his head in shame. Axel and Rosewood watch T burn with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stretch parked at anger and disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: limo with вЂњJust MarriedвЂќ painted on the rear window i the curb while -- Taggert bids farewell to Johnny and his new bride, luggag other personals by their side.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Look, Dad. I don't know when I can pay you back.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: It's okay. I never really got you a real wedding present. And remember what I said. Don't come back until I tell you it's safe.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: We're gonna find Ricky and the rest of that money and straighten this thing out. But I don't want you two to worry about it. I know too many cops in this town. I'm not gonna let anything happen to any of you. Johnny cracks a half-hearted smile.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Thanks, pop.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Now give me a hug.  43 Johnny throws an arm around Taggert while Jordan watches smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosewood and Axel watch Taggert and son from the backseat limo. The two sit across from one another. Rosewood havin nice scotch while Axel sips a can of soda.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You know, I've heard of Moms crying at weddings but never cos the bride got shot in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Look at the bright side. They could have killed her and not the dress. One day they're gonna look back on this and laugh their asses off. Trust me. Rosewood isn't convinced.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, maybe not, but check this out. Axel reaches in his coat, grabs a wrinkled photograph of MARCUS and hands it to Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Lola Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: And who's Lola Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Her father hired me to track her down after she disappeared a few months back. She was staying in LA for the better part of last year until she got busted on a drug possession.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I never saw her.  44

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: She came back to Detroit and somebody killed her.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You got any leads?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Not until today. The guy that popped her just so happens to be the same asshole that shot up a wedding this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You saw this guy?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I was there. He took her out, along with her girlfriend. Tried to take me out along with them. I don't know about Lola, but I'm pretty sure her friend was a pro. Rosewood thinks it all over.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Johnny mentioned this guy was running prostitutes.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Bingo. The only problem is, other than a possession charge, I got nothin' on her. Ever since her bust last year, her record's clean. Rosewood's eyes dance, in deep thought.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Just like she was protected. Axel squints. He's not following.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got a feeling I know who Ricky was working for. Axel smiles. In steps Taggert who pops a long cubano in h mouth and lights up.  45

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (to Taggert) How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Okay. So now what? The LIMO DRIVER reaches over his seat, stares back at the friends in the back.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: Where to, gentlemen? Taggert, Axel and Rosewood share a silly grin. The AXEL F begins in the b.g. Axel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Shhhhit. Rosewood massages his sore temples in anticipation of thi come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's after hours and most of the office lights are off. A spotlight burns over Rosewood's desk as he sits at his co and searches an IAD database. Axel and Taggert hover over him.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: So this is what IAD looks like? Guess it's familiar territory to you, huh, Axel?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Blow yourself.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: It's a very nice office, Billy, but what're we doing here again?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I'll show you in a second.  46 A full page report appears on Rosewood's computer, along color photograph of a familiar redhead REENA O'BRIEN -- L friend.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: That's her! That's the redhead who got hit with Lola! The pro!

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You're kidding?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (confused) Who's Lola?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What do you got on the redhead?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: A few weeks back, this Reena comes in to file an official complaint about a vice officer named Eddie Stone.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember Stone. Crazy bastard. Spent more time in IAD than any cop I ever knew.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: According to her, Stone busts her one night, but instead of taking her to county they go see this guy. This rich Chinaman up in the Hills they call 'The Maestro'. That ring a bell to you?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Maestro? Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Anyways, he gives her an envelope full of cash and says вЂњyou work for me nowвЂќ. That same night, they go to her place, pack her things and move her into this mansion. (beat) Now this Reena said she wasn't the only one. There's at least thirty to forty other girls living in this house.  47

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Picking them up off the street. Just like they did Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So who is he? The Chinaman?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's just it. Before she can finish giving her statement she flips out and splits. I guess she decided against at the last minute. Never gave his name.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (impatient) So what you're saying is...you still have no idea who this guy is? Rosewood cracks a knowing smile.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So you do know him?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I ran the name 'Maestro' as an alias through Interpol. I got a match with a guy named Harry Phan. He's been linked to everything from smuggling in drugs from China to trafficking young women. It also turns out he's been buying up real estate all over Los Angeles. (beat) Hotels, restaurants, a Chinese grocery, a whole foods distributor. You name it, he's got it. Axel and Rosewood wave away the nasty cigar smoke.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Bought and paid for with drug money.  48

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's what it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So Reena wanted out, came to IAD to rat out some cops and got cold feet. Decides it was easier just to split town and come back to Detroit. But what's this gotta do with Lola?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I don't know. It would help if I knew who the hell Lola was. Axel laughs. He smacks Taggert in the belly on his way to door.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll tell you all about it in the car. Taggert follows him out as Rosewood shuts off his compute then the desk light.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to make a pit stop.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. вЂњTHE PIT STOPвЂќ GAS AND SUSHI - NIGHT Axel, Taggert and Rosewood drive up in Rosewood's Lexus a three curious friends observe this spectacular joint. This is no ordinary service station, from the structure's modernistic design to the glowing NEON LIGHTS streamlinin building, and the gorgeous female VALET, with fake breast a form fitting mini-skirt, parking cars for dinner. At every gas pump is a drop dead gorgeous woman filling t and taking orders for a full car detail. Axel laughs as he stares through the car wash's large win watches a crew of silver bikinis detail a FERRARI. A wild STROBE LIGHT illuminates the room as LOUD MUSIC blares. It's a regular dance party.  49

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I gotta say, I've seen some strange things in my time but I've never had sushi from a gas station. Rosewood seems surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: That's why it's perfect. Makes for a good front. No one would ever think to eat here.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I don't know. I hear they make a mean dragon roll.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Tell you what. I might be in here awhile. Why don't you guys go get us some food. I don't know about you guys, but my belly's growlin'. It's gonna be a long night and even longer on an empty stomach.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: In other words, you're goin' at this alone and you don't want us messing up the works?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: No offense, but with you guys walkin' in there, they gonna smell the cops comin' a mile away. And let's face it. You guys were never cut out for undercover work.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: So we're supposed to just sit here and wait?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Just like old times.  50

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You got the money?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Ten thousand smacks. Taggert hands a thick envelope to Axel.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This better work, Axel. This is John's life you're carrying around.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: It's a good thing my shit always works then, isn't it? Taggert and Rosewood share a look and roll their eyes in

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: An hour. Axel steps out, heads for the door. Rosewood squints, con

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: A long night? What does he mean long night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel steps inside and takes it in. A full grocery center a fine wine and liquors section and cigar shop on one sid a posh SUSHI BAR and restaurant on the other. A shifty looking character in a flash vest and goofy bow standing behind a mahogany desk marked вЂњReservationsвЂќ Axel watches as the young DESK CLERK sniffs from a small spray bottle. His eyes wide and dancing. Axel laughs as he approaches the desk. The Desk Clerk spots him coming and fumbles with his tie.  51 Axel plays nervous as he puts on a pair of shades and car watches his back.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (thug voice) Hey, my man. Someone call a plumber? Cos I'm here to snake the drain.

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: Snake the drain?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You know? Unclog the pipes? The Desk Clerk is still clueless.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, this still ain't sinkin' in. How about this. Axel plays nervous as he watches his back and leans on th

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's say I gotta use the bathroom, okay? But the shit's busted. There's a sign on the door sayin' I can only go number one. Number one's cool. I gotta go number one real bad. The Desk Clerk just shakes his head in confusion, not fol along.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But let's say I'm in there awhile. All the sudden, I decide I wanna sit down and stay for awhile. Maybe go number two. Now, do I gotta decide before I go in there if I'm doin' a number one or number two?...Or can I wait and see if the mood hits? Axel nervously rubs the back of his neck as the Desk Cler slowly cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see what I'm sayin' to you now? The Desk Clerk finally nods with understanding.  52

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel makes it past the front desk and heads for an elevat spots a slew of YOUNG LADIES in evening gowns and well-dr BUSINESSMEN bellied up at a bar, drinking martinis. Axel swipes a GOLD CARD into a slit near the elevator doo the shiny gold doors open. He steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel steps off the elevator and is greeted by a long couc of beautiful YOUNG LADIES in slinky lingerie. They all st unison, greet him with a foney smile.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yes. This could definitely be a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosewood and Taggert watch the building, bored, same old they wait for Axel. Taggert sips a black coffee.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm doin' this shit again.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Come on, Sarge. You're having fun. Admit it.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sitting out here, waiting on Axel. Not knowing what the hell's going on. This is great. Rosewood grows visibly irritated.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: It wouldn't kill you to say that you miss me. Just a little.  53 Taggert rolls his eyes, talks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Billy. I'm not happy about being here. But if I have to be here ...then I'm glad it's with you. Rosewood hides his goofy smile.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Me too, Sarge. I feel the same way.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: You're not gonna slip me the tongue, are you? Rosewood loses his chipper smile. He huffs under his brea

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's not funny, Sarge. Taggert watches Rosewood closely.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Hell you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just be careful with the gay jokes around me. That's all. Taggert scans his old partner up and down as he puffs on cigar. He gives up and plops down in his seat, keeps an e on Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel is escorted into a perfectly lit, ultra high-tech be with king sized bed, silk sheets and mirrored ceiling. A video camera is set up on a tripod while a FLATSCREEN T on the wall. Axel's paid escort SKYLER (20), great build, but a foney of too much plastic surgery, sprawls out on the bed, pose seductively as Axel watches. Axel holds the envelope of money behind his back.  54

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Are you gonna stand there all night? Or are you gonna get comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'm comfortable, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: So what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Does it really matter?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: So you're one of those guys who likes to get right to it. That's cool. She pats the bedsheets, invites him over.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don't you get a little closer? Axel tosses the envelope of money onto the sheets in fron his date. She flips through the cash.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow. I've got my work cut out for me, don't I?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: That money's not for you. It's for your boss. I got a message for him. Inside the envelope he'll find the name and address of where I want the money delivered. Then I want him to send a message along with it. Ten grand, compliments of John Taggert. His debt's officially paid off.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You don't need to understand. You just need to send the message. And tell your boss if he doesn't do it ...there's some cops who might be interested in his little operation.  55

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: So you're just gonna leave me this money?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I figured you would ask me that, so let's be clear. I'm gonna be calling to see if he got that money. If he doesn't have it come morning...and if I think you ran off with it, stole it or whatever...I'm gonna let your boss know all about it. And then I'm gonna drop his name, along with you and all your girlfriends names to the cops. Skyler gazes down at the envelope, sick to her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it. Have a good night. Axel heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're doing a very good job here. Skyler stares at his pants, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can see that. Axel bashfully covers himself on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come back and see me when you have some time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel, Taggert and Rosewood watch the front door closely, patiently as Taggert rubs his sore eyes and Rosewood stru to keep his head up.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Okay, now what?  56 The sound of Taggert's voice startles Rosewood out of his

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Be cool, man. Now all we gotta do is follow the money.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I still don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What's there to get? It's very simple. We're giving Johnny's share of the money back, and still paying off his football debt. Meanwhile we can get this Eddie Stone by the ass all at the same time when we catch him with the money. Rosewood rubs his temples, a nervous habit.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Blackmailing cops? This...this is not good. At all.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What're you getting all worked up about? I thought you wanted to bust this guy?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: By handing him a bag of stolen cash? It's not exactly what I had in mind. I'm Internal Affairs now, Axel. I could lose my job.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (furious) Your job? What about John? He's got a little more than his job on the line.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm just saying.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Would you guys relax? You're not gonna lose your job and nothing's gonna happen to John. We got this.  57 Rosewood spots the familiar face of Eddie Stone heading o front door with the envelope of cash.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Hey. It's him. Taggert quickly sits up. Axel uses binoculars to watch St he heads to his Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Where did he come from?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: He's leaving. He must've been in there the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: He took the bait.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Now what? He lowers the binoculars, smiles at the others.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we go to breakfast. Fuck do you think? Now we tail him and follow the money. Rosewood waits until Stone pulls out of the lot and slowl follows behind, staying safely out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rosewood's Lexus enters Mulholland Drive, a whole swar black and white patrol cruisers, lights flashing, box the forcing them to the curb. TWO OFFICERS leap from the car in front of them, guns dra moving in.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?  58

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Looks like your boy Stone made us.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: They're stalling us.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Ya think?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: It's okay. Rosewood turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys are with me. Just keep quiet and let me do the talking. OFFICER #1 draws down on Rosewood from the driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Out of the car! Keep your hands where I can see them!

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (to Officer) It's okay! I'ma cop! I'm just gonna reach for my badge! Rosewood reaches in his coat as the Officer breaks his pi through the window, shards flying onto Rosewood's lap.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Hands...on the dash!

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (to Rosewood) I feel safer already. With a goofy expression, Rosewood slowly raises his hands Taggert does likewise. Axel places his hands on the dash.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel and Taggert rest on a steel slab bench as Rosewood p the dirty floor, shakes his head, mumbles. There's a DRAG in skirt and pumps sitting next to Axel and watching Rose nervous fit.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Quit it, would ya?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Quit what?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: That thing you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What thing?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Pacing and mumbling. I hate it when you do that. You don't have to whisper, ya know? It's no secret you're pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: When I get nervous I talk to myself.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: You're nervous? You're making me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You're not the one about to lose your job.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Your job? What about losing the money? We don't even know where it is.

dialogues.speaker: DRAG QUEEN
dialogues.text: (to Axel) What're you in for?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'm about to be in here for killin' a couple cops.  60

dialogues.speaker: DRAG QUEEN
dialogues.text: You too? Axel nonchalantly shifts in his seat, faces away from the queen and watches Taggert and Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: How much longer we gotta be in here?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I don't know. They impounded my car so I got us a ride. She'll be here in an hour, maybe less.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: She?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I got an idea, Billy. Why don't you flash your badge. That'll scare their pants off. Axel laughs. Rosewood hangs his head in shame. A CORRECTI OFFICER opens up their cell. Axel, Taggert, and the drag stand. He fixes his skirt. c.O. You got a visitor. Axel, Taggert, Rosewood head out. The C.O. points at Rose

dialogues.speaker: C.O., (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just you, Lieutenant. The three friends share a befuddled look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosewood is escorted inside by the Corrections Officer wh is greeted by IAD Inspector Weinberg. Rosewood huffs with exhaustion and frustration. He shakes head at Weinberg who is ear to ear smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: They send you to give me my walking papers, Weinberg?  61

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: I should be so lucky. (nods to a chair) Sit down, Lieutenant. Rosewood sits down in protest. Weinberg stands.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: So you wanna know about the money? Where it came from?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary. Rosewood is visibly confused.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know all about your friend Taggert and his kid. I also know that your friend Foley is in town and is helping you break open this Harry Phan investigation. I'm here to tell you to stop.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Who sent you?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: I've been working in conjunction with federal agents who've been tracking Phan's activities for the last seven months. Including his involvement with several officers in this police department.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You knew about Phan this whole time?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: I've got a number of undercover officers in the field trying to get on Phan's payroll. Eddie Stone included. You and your friends almost blew his cover with that little stunt you pulled. If Phan or any of his associates find out a police officer is blackmailing Stone, he'll have him killed just to be on the safe side.  62

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, the feds want your job for compromising their guy. Thanks to me, I made them a better offer.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: I told them I'd make you a deal. We use that money to take care of your friend Taggert's football debt and you walk away. Leave Harry Phan alone. Rosewood halfheartedly scoffs under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? I mean...this whole time?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
