dialogues.text: Because I knew you wouldn't let it go. You'd insist on getting involved in the investigation. I'm here to tell you that if you don't let this go, word will leak about Taggert's kid and that money, and your involvement in attempting to bribe an undercover officer.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Don't beat around the bush, Weinberg. Tell me how you really feel. Weinberg sits on the edge of the desk, stares Rosewood do a dead serious look.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: It's up to you, Rosewood. What's it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel, Rosewood and Taggert drag ass as they wait behind a iron gate. A BUZZER sounds and the door opens as a CORREC OFFICER escorts the three buddies out. Axel smiles and laughs as he spots --  63 JENNY SUMMERS (50s), now a red head, still beautiful, awa them all in chairs. She stands, gives a coy smile as she her arms and observes this motley crew.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I knew this day was coming soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This modest motel was once a beautiful beachfront inn, bu been beaten down by its hard partying guests as LOUD RAP blares from the parking lot and SCANTILY CLAD HOOKERS wal and out of the many rooms. Thugged out cars and low-rider trucks sit parked in front several motel room doors with their engines running and s blasting. One HOOKER counts her money as she is getting picked up b ride, waiting in the lot. INT. SEA HORSE MOTEL/FRONT DESK -вЂ” DAY Detectives BENSON and DIEGO await in a back room near the desk as the motel's owner -- CARL (40s), three day beard, stressed out and tired, fran searches for his smokes under a stack of unpaid bills. He one and sparks up.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You guys think you're walking out of here with thirty percent of my take for the month, then you're wrong!

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Is that right? Officer Stone's gonna be real disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: These fuckin' kids are savages! Drug deals, hookers, guns! Your little operation's destroyed my business! They're supposed to keep things nice and quiet! That was the deal!  Carl gets Diego and 64

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Hey. You're making money. What's the problem? in his face.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Every couple hours, I got vice in here threatening to shut me down if I don't start cleaning house! (beat) You tell Stone this wasn't part of the deal! I was supposed to get protection!

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No! It's not all! You tell him if he doesn't start beefing up security around here, I'll be the first one to drop a dime to the cops! And if he still wants his cut, he knows what to do! You tell him that! Now go screw! Both of you!

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: I'll be sure he gets the message. Benson head out as Carl watches them leave and gulps down his double shot of crown royal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benson and Diego follow Stone, in his swim trunks and an robe, out a gin and a sliding glass door and onto a pool deck as he sips tonic. Stone heads for a wet bar near the deep end to get a refr his glass.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Your boy at the motel's ready to crack. I think he's ready for a sit down.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: You collect the money?  65

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: No. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: Good. Don't. Let him think he's in charge. We got him right where we want him. Stone grabs a pitcher of gin and tonic, pours another gla

dialogues.speaker: STONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now onto other business. This shit stick cop Rosewood is starting to really irritate me. (beat) Someone's been doing some talking. Stone pours an extra glass. Diego and Benson turn and sta one another.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: Whadd'ya mean?

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: Rosewood's IAD. Him and his buddy Foley got a lead on our operation at The Pit Stop. One plus one equals a rat.

dialogues.speaker: DIEGO
dialogues.text: You got any leads on who it is?

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: Oh. I have a pretty good idea. Stone reaches under a magazine and grabs a silenced TWENT pistol, swiftly turns, fires at Diego's head. Pow! -- as the bullet blows Diego's face apart and his body is INTO THE DEEP END. Benson is in shock as he watches his dead partner's body the pool with blood. Stone isn't phased in the least as he removes the silence  66

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: I figure Rosewood got to one of you. If I was wrong about him, that means you're the rat. Stone nods to Diego.

dialogues.speaker: STONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a good look. If you don't want that to happen to you, then you're gonna take care of this Rosewood. Once and for all. Show me that I didn't make a mistake by bringing you in on this.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON
dialogues.text: What about Taggert and Foley?

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: You're a real smart cop, Benson. You figure it out. Stone sips his drink and heads for the door. Benson just in awe of this shocking turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: STONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get this cleaned up. I have company coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the eighteenth floor of this half-way constructed fi hotel in the making. No walls or windows, just brick, cem and foundation. A cool breeze blows a swift wind through the hollow passa this unfinished building. Harry Phan, Stiggs, a few of Harry's goons, and NIKOS THO (50s), balding, spiked hair, arms dealer, stroll the floo

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're still months away from a completion date and now they're threatening to shut down construction until I can cover the remaining costs.  67

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can only move so much money before the IRS starts asking too many questions.

dialogues.speaker: THOMOPOLIS
dialogues.text: And that's where I come in, right? That's why you invited me up here. And here I thought it was for the pretty view. Thomopolis smiles as he steps closer to the edge and star into the bright orange sunset. The Santa Monica pier ferr wheel lights glowing in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm your most loyal customer, Nick. As you are mine. What I'm proposing is taking our partnership a step further. Thomopolis turns, bored with the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: THOMOPOLIS
dialogues.text: Don't jerk me off, Phan. I jerked off enough in prison. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You put up the rest of the money and I'll guarantee major purchases on your next five shipments. Thomopolis laughs.

dialogues.speaker: THOMOPOLIS
dialogues.text: From the sounds of things, you'll be in jail long before that. Besides. I don't believe in guarantees. I believe in money.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My empire is continuing to grow at an unprecedented rate. And... (beat) ...I have protection. The kind of protection a man in your position can only dream of.  68 Thomopolis can feel Stiggs watching him like a creep in t corner. An evil scowl on his face.

dialogues.speaker: THOMOPOLIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, your men are making me feel warm all over. I got butterflies. Harry cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, our nervous manager from the Sea Horse Motel, drags cigarette and runs his hand across the pier's railing, wa so patiently as he checks his watch every few seconds. He turns, stunned to see Harry Phan waiting some ten feet and puffing his own cigarette. A couple of his delinquent SOLDIERS cover Carl from both the pier, boxing him in.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Shit, man. You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Please excuse the time. I hope we haven't kept you waiting. Carl watches the two soldiers on either side of him, maki nervous and unsure.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I said I wanted to meet alone. No guns and no goons. Just us.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Now that wouldn't be very safe this time of night. Carrying around all this money myself. Carl notices that one of the soldiers is carrying a backp some sort on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Money? What're you talking about?  69

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I hear you're not happy with your current role. Officer Stone tells me the police have caught wind of our operation and made life difficult for you. Because of this you're being pressured to come forward. Carl grows even more nervous as the two soldiers step clo him, looking very angry.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, they're not leaving me much choice. They're gonna shut me down if I don't do something. (beat) Stone gave me a guarantee this wouldn't be a problem. Now, all of a sudden, I got cops all over my ass.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I understand. The police can be very stubborn in their pursuits. They get wind of something...they just don't let up until they get their man. It's the cost of doing this kind of business, Mister Dunn. A business that you just aren't cut out for. Unfortunately, your involvement in this has made the officers in my charge uncomfortable to say the least. Soldier #1 with the backpack steps forward, causes Carl s as he steps back.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is your early retirement, Mister Dunn. All you have to do now is hand over control of the motel to me. You let me and Mister Stone worry about keeping the police in check. Soldier #1 unzips the bag and throws it on the pavement i of Carl.  70

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I see what this is. Whadd'ya think, I'm stupid, Phan? You and your hoods running me out of my own motel. I bet those same cops are in your pocket too. Well forget it. I want back in. Fifty percent.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's not an option. Our offer is more than sufficient, Mister Dunn. If I were you I'd take it and not utter one more fucking word about it. Carl notices Soldier #2 going for a gun and pulls his own from inside his coat. He draws down on Harry.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Back off! Harry motions to Soldier #2 to lay off his gun. He slowly his hand out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary. You will take this money and we will not speak of this again. (beat) This is a war you cannot win. Don't be foolish.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm gonna have to think this over. In the meantime, you're gonna sweeten the deal. JI want another hundred. Payable by the week's end. If you don't have it by then, I'm going to the police. We'll see how loyal your cop friends are after they're brought in for questioning. Harry thinks it over. An insincere smile.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'll have to take it to my people. You're a very shrewd businessman, Mister Dunn. And also very stubborn. We'll be in touch. Carl grabs the bag of cash, makes his way off the pier.  71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl carries his bag of cash over his shoulder as he leav beach and cuts across a small parking lot. He spots a sha looking SURFER GIRL leaning on his car and smoking a join She stumbles toward him, playing the role.

dialogues.speaker: SURFER GIRL
dialogues.text: Say, buddy. You wanna buy some shit?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No, I don't. Get the hell away from my car. The Surfer Girl almost trips on her own feet as she steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: SURFER GIRL
dialogues.text: Come on, man. Just a bag. You should mellow out. Maybe we can go somewhere, make you feel good. She reaches for his face, strokes the side of his cheek w fingers.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Get out of my way you dirty bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SURFER GIRL
dialogues.text: What's your problem, man? We should take a little walk on the beach and chill. I'll hook you up, ya know? Come on, man. Show me some money. Carl gets fed up, drops his bag of money and pulls his gu sticks it in her face.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I said get out of here! Before he knows what's happening, Carl is grabbed from be an arm is wrapped around his throat and he drops his weap The Surfer Girl takes off, into the night as a couple mor appear and take turns throwing Carl a beating.  72 THUG #1 knees him in the crotch as Carl falls to his knee man behind him releases his throat as THUG #2 kicks him i chest and knocks him to the asphalt. All three men, all dressed like pot-head beach bums, take kicking and beating Carl to a pulp. THUG #1 wraps a long wire around Carl's throat and finish job as the other two watch. Carl finally gives as Thug #1 releases him, lets him fall ground. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's BMW convertible parks in a guests spot in front o high-priced complex. Several palm trees and a colorful fl garden circle a sign that reads вЂњBEVERLY TERRACEвЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny behind the wheel, Axel shotgun and Rosewood and Tag the back seat, looking whipped.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Okay. I thought we were going for a nice after dinner drink. Does anyone wanna tell me what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Look at this place. Hard to believe Ricky living in a place like this.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: And they say crime doesn't pay.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Who's Ricky?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I guess it would be asking too much if you waited in the car. Jenny watches Rosewood and Taggert in the rear view mirro suspiciously quiet.  73

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'll just be a minute or two, tops. Rosewood here will keep you company.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable. You said you weren't working. You promised me.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I did? I don't remember saying that shit. Axel turns to the fellas in the back.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you guys remember me sayin' that? Rosewood and Taggert shake their heads in unison.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Jenny) They don't remember you sayin' that. I don't think you heard me right. You should probably have your ears checked or somethin' like that. Maybe cut your hair. (redirects) Which is looking very nice, by the way. Very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Cut the shit, Axel. I remember you very specifically saying that you were in town on vacation and wanted to catch up. Next thing I know, I see you with Heckel and Jeckel here coming out of a jail cell. Rosewood and a cigar chomping Taggert share a look.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then you lied to me again when you said it was all just a big mix-up. I guess I didn't hear you right.  74

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: No, you didn't. But it's okay. I forgive you. Jenny huffs in exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'd love for us all to catch up and have a drink. Tell you what. When we're done here, we can all go back to your place and relax, okay? Have a few drinks and who knows. (beat) We can all spend the whole night together if you want. Have like a big sleepover. But right now, I gotta go upstairs with Taggert. Let you and Rosewood have a chance to get reacquainted. Rosewood doesn't seem keen on the idea as he shuts his ey mumbles under his breath. Taggert watches him, curious. Jenny stares at Rosewood in the rear view mirror, and she as enthused for this plan.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Wonderful. (stares at Rosewood) Be still my beating heart.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Billy, you don't mind stayin' with Jenny and keeping her company, right? Rosewood rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Axel notices Jenny and Rosewood giving each other a dirty and shares an exchange with Taggert, who also senses some hostility in the air.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Wonderful. (to Taggert) You hear that, Taggert? Wonderful.  75 Taggert watches Rosewood rub his sore eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Taggert and Axel step out, leaving a frustrated Jenny and Rosewood alone.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: A sleepover? What is he talking about, sleepover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel and Taggert push open the already busted open door a does a quick sweep of the front room, gun drawn. The place is a disaster. The cushions of the couch flippe the back of a leather recliner ripped to shreds as white stuffing covers the carpet. Taggert checks the messy kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Every cabinet door and drawer have been flung open or dro the floor, leaving a mess of kitchen utensils, tools and silverware. Also on the ground are various pots and pans and other co A round kitchen table rests in the corner with a full can coffee dumped onto the surface. Several bags of potato chips and crackers have also been onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Call me obvious...but I think someone was having a hard time finding that money.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: On the carpet, Axel picks up a busted picture frame as he being cut by the glass. It's a picture of Ricky having a at a club with a hot waitress on his shoulder, both smili  76 A look of surprise on Axel as he slowly figures out that girl is SKYLER, his paid escort at The Pit Stop.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Hey, Taggert. Taggert slowly shuffles his way into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: This girl with Ricky. It's the same chick I saw at The Pit Stop. Taggert grabs the photo, takes a look for himself.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What was she? A waitress?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: This girl does a whole lot more than bussing tables.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I wonder if Ricky's aware of that.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: My guess is he is. Taggert squints, confused.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Those girls are charging two grand a head and the place was crawlin' with suits. They take in a whole helluva lot more than twenty k a night.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What're you saying? That Johnny was lying about the twenty grand?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'm saying if Ricky ripped this place off, he took a lot more than twenty thousand, whether John's aware of it or not.  77

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: A place like that, you can't just run in with a ski mask and stick up the place.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Exactly. Ricky says he worked for this guy Phan. Maybe he was the bag man. He gets the money from point A to point B, only --

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: -- It never gets to point B. Axel ponders it all. A moment of realization hits him lik sack of bricks.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'm gonna check the bedroom. Axel hurries to a corner bedroom as Taggert follows behin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel flips on the lights and notices a perfectly made bed center of the room. The drawers of a large oak armoire ha pulled and dumped to the carpet, only they are empty. Axel bites his lip, in deep thought. He opens up a closet and finds it completely empty. No clothes, hangers, nothi

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yo, Taggert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggert notices the sink is spotless with an empty toothb stand on top. He opens up a medicine cabinet and finds it also empty.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Yeah? Axel enters.  78

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You notice anything strange?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Doesn't look like anyone lives here.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Ricky didn't come runnin' back here after the wedding. It would be the first place they'd look for that cash. He packed his shit long before that.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Ready to skip town.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: No wonder he was so nervous at the wedding. He knew they were lookin' for him. Which probably means he worked for them as a currier. It's the same thing that got my friend Mikey killed. When the shit turns up missing, they don't exactly have to narrow down the list to find out who did it.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: If they know he's the last one to touch the cash, why risk taking it? It doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: A kid like Ricky grew up with nothing and spent half his life living on the streets. He probably got sick at starin' at all that cash and lost his head.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Okay, so where is he? Axel stares down at the broken photo of Ricky and Skyler.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe we should ask Skyler and find out.  719

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosewood now in the front seat with Jenny. They are stran quiet, avoiding each other as Rosewood sneaks a few peeks and there.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I never thanked you for coming to get us.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (angry) Yeah, well, if I knew why, I wouldn't have. Rosewood obviously bites his tongue and fights hard to re from responding. He takes another look at Jenny, not so mad this time, but a look of nostalgia, secretly fond of this woman.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You know, I haven't told him.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Told who what?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: About us. Whadd'ya think I meant?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: As far as I'm concerned, there's not much to tell. Rosewood seems sad, almost offended.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was that bad. Jenny scoffs at him, shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, Billy, it was the best month of my life.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You don't have to be so cruel about it.  80 Jenny sees Rosewood sulking, feels bad.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What did you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: We were an unnatural act. A case of mistaking wild coincidence as fate.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: We were single, lonely and depressed. We just happened to be in the same supermarket at the exact same time waiting in the exact same line.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (reflects) Lane three.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: We just let things move way too fast because you thought it was meant to be.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Maybe it was. But I guess we'll never know because you were too scared to find out. Rosewood starts to boil. He tries to bite his tongue but quite do it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I never said it was fate. I just thought that since... (thinks it over) ...well...never mind. Jenny won't let it go.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Since what?  81

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Well, I was gonna say I may've got the wrong impression when you came onto me at the art gallery. Jenny bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Are you on drugs?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You gotta admit, you were definitely throwing a sexual vibe my direction. Jenny neurotically begins rubbing her sore temples as she her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I have a headache all over my body. Please stop speaking, okay? Rosewood spots Axel and Taggert heading for the car.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Here they come. (beat) We'll talk about this later.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I'll try to keep my hands to myself until then. Axel and Taggert jump in. Axel carries an ANSWERING MACHI his lap. Ricky's answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Well? How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: It's coming together. Axel notices how upset Jenny is.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How'd it go here?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Wonderful.  82 Axel smiles, checks with Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Axel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front door walks Jenny, Axel, Taggert, and Ro as Axel marvels at the high-priced digs before him. Jenny moved up in the world since we saw her last. An entire collection of eclectic artwork hangs from the w relics of the now closed Hollis-Benton Gallery. A pricey crystal chandelier dangles from the ceiling abov spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yo, man. It's lifestyles of the rich and famous. (stunned) Is this your house? Jenny scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Stop acting so surprised. Rosewood rolls his eyes as he strolls the living room wit hands in his pocket, disinterested and unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (smug) It's her boyfriend's. The doctor. Jenny bumps Rosewood out of the way as she follows Tagger Axel into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Thought maybe you stole it or somethinвЂ™.  83

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: You'd know about stealing houses, wouldn't you, Foley?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Touche. Taggert grabs a plastic barbecue lighter from a drawer, s up a cigar. Jenny yanks it right out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Don't even think of lighting that tobacco asshole in this house.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, we wouldn't wanna ruin the smell of new money. Axel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Paul is bronchial. The faintest smell of cigar smoke and he'll kill me.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: We wouldn't wanna upset Paul, now would we?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Ya know, I haven't been a cop for awhile but I'm sensing some tension in the air. (to Taggert) Whatta you think, Taggert?

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: The air is a bit thick.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Let's just say Jenny got a better offer. A bigger wall to hang all her pretty artwork.  84 Jenny gives up and heads to a liquor cabinet, pours all o a nice double shot. Taggert gets a very upset, almost confused look on his fa

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: You and Jenny were an item?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Yes, it was a very brief affair to say the least. Jenny hands everyone a drink except Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Yes, and Billy hasn't been able to let it go. Rosewood steps uncomfortably close to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: That's because Jen has been unable to accept the fact that she still has feelings for me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Where do you get this stuff? Jenny turns her back on him, gulps down her drink as if h a sensitive nerve.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: The eyes, Jen. The eyes never lie.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: I taught him that.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Hold up. I just thought of something. Billy and me shared a woman.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Axel!  85

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (surprised) Really? That's news to me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: That's cos it was a one time thing and we were kids. And we were drunk at the time.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Well you don't have to make it sound so cheap.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Gee, I'm sorry, Axel. What girl doesn't dream of getting it in the back of a Chevy Nova? Axel laughs. Taggert still looks confused as he rolls a c in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: So...you and Billy...and Axel? I don't suppose you could...

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: No, I don't suppose I could!

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: John. Take it easy. Show some respect. Jenny seems flattered by his goofy gesture, but tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (to Jenny) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, Taggert, show some respect. (to Jenny) So who's better? Me or Rosewood? Jenny goes for an instant refill on her vodka rocks.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  86 Rosewood shakes his head with disgust at Axel and Taggert comments.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Come on, guys.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Hey, Jen. I'm sorry really. I'm being bad again. Didn't mean to put you on the spot like that. My bad. Rosewood makes a desperate gesture for Axel to lay off. T laughs under his breath. Axel pauses. He can't hold it any longer.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So who's bigger? Me or Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: On that note, I'm taking a shower. Rosewood seems to like that idea.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Rosewood) Alone. Jenny storms off, out of the kitchen and up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Damn, man, what did you do to her?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I guess...maybe it's possible I came on too strong.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Noooo. Rosewood slumps down at a kitchen table. Depressed and ti

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Women. Can't live with em. Someone fix me a drink. Axel laughs. Taggert heads for the liquor cabinet.  87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel splashes some cold water in his face, freshens up a Jenny leans on the open door frame, watches him with a sm Axel is caught by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Just making sure you're not stealing a bathrobe or something. Axel laughs. Jenny gives him an overdue hug.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, what's this I hear about you not being a cop?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Well, I figured there's only so many times you can be passed over for promotion before you realize it's never gonna happen. Plus, I thought I could make better money on my own. Axel hops up on the sink as he pulls a business card from wallet, hands it to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (reads card) Axel Foley Investigations.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I guess you could say my past finally caught up with me.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, no offense, but I don't really see you as Captain material.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What, you can't see me in a suit and tie behind the desk with Rosewood?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: No, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, me either. But it's okay though. Business is good. I'm happy.  88

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How bout you? I hear you're a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah, an RN. That's how I met Paul. He's a surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Oh, obviously. (smiles) And?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Do you like him? Jenny cracks a goofy grin.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Of course I like him. What kind of question is that?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So what about Rosewood? What happened there?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Nothing. It happened. Now it's over. Don't worry about it. Jenny playfully shoves Axel as she steps out. Axel laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taggert's pants are rolled up as he soaks his sore feet i tub and puffs his cigar. Rosewood sits at a laptop doing some research. Jenny sips gin and tonic as Axel appears through a sliding glass doo answering machine in his hand. He goes to Rosewood, checks over his shoulder, reviews th web page.  89

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Rosewood. What're you reading?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: It's an IA database. With my password, I can access it from any computer. This is everything I have on Harry Phan. Rosewood scans through a digital file of crime scene phot unsolved homicides, stabbings, shootings, overdoses, all men and women in their teens and twenties.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's been over two dozen juvenile deaths in the greater Los Angeles area in the last month. All of the victims have one thing in common. All John and Jane Does. No ID, no history, no next of kin. And all unsolved. Axel takes the mouse and scans through a few more images unsolved homicide cases.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGES
dialogues.text: -- a young HOMELESS MAN is found dead under a bridge, sur by newspapers and other garbage. -- a TEEN GIRL is face down in an alley. An overdose. A l line of people waiting to get into a club is seen in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are just a few of em. Stabbings, shootings, overdoses.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: This is LA, Billy. It's not really that uncommon.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I showed some photos around at the local homeless shelters. They identified over a third of the deceased. Taggert and Axel share an intrigued look. Jenny hears the doorbell, heads out.  90

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: This guy Phan is recruiting them straight out of the shelters.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Makes them an offer they can't refuse. A place to stay, a free supply of junk. More money than they've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: And when the cops get too close...

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Or they become too big a problem to handle, he bumps them off. Through the sliding glass walks Jenny and her surprise gu BOGOMIL (48) short blonde hair, professional look with ma business suit, successful. Axel, Taggert and Rosewood light up as she enters the poo A big smile on all their faces.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Hey, trouble maker. Axel and Jan share a big hug. Jenny twirls her ice cubes throws Rosewood a dirty stare.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Nice to see you too, Axel. Axel laughs. Jan waves at Taggert.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Uncle John.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie. Jan leans in and gives Rosewood a hug around his neck, gi a big wet kiss on the neck and mouth.  91 Jenny shakes her head in disgust. Axel and Taggert share confused smile. Axel points at Rosewood, and then Jan, pieces it all toge he turns to Jenny. She rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Hey, babe.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: A lot better now. Jan gives him another wet one on the mouth. Jenny sticks finger down her neck as Taggert laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (to Rosewood) You and Bogomil's daughter?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Thanks, Uncle John. I almost forgot my real name. Axel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Oh. I guess you could say it was an accident. There I was waiting in line at the supermarket... Jenny and Axel share a funny look. Taggert can't help but as Rosewood bashfully looks away.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And out of nowhere comes Billy. We hadn't talked in almost two years, and just like that. There he was. I guess you could call it fate.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fate. It's a funny thing.  92 Jenny takes another huge belt of her gin and tonic. Rosewood quickly changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: So anyways. What did you find out today?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: So much for memory lane. Jan hands Rosewood a manila file full of paperwork. He ta look at the thick set of papers.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your friend Harry Phan's been a busy boy. He's being investigated in at least eight counts of insurance and tax fraud. He owes something in excess of four to five million in back taxes. Taggert is now intrigued as he crawls out of the hot tub, the others.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that's just what we were able to find. God knows what else this guy's into.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: My guy in the IRS says Phan's big thing now is targeting failing businesses that are struggling financially, offers a third of what the property is worth while the owner takes the money and runs. Taggert hangs on every word as he slowly takes a seat nex Jenny. She waves away his nasty cigar smoke.

dialogues.speaker: JAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the seller keeps his name on the books while Phan stays in the clear. When the IRS gets wind of what's going on, Phan moves on to his next target. This guy's making millions under the table. Axel seems focused. He hurries back to the laptop.  93

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Rosewood. Go back a few photos. I wanna check something. Rosewood grabs the mouse, moves through the still images he stops on the YOUNG GIRL in the back alley. A nightclub the back ground. Axel points at the long line of people in the distance. T some chinese writing on the wall in bright glowing NEON L Axel sets

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There. That club across the street. Where is this?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: It's this club on Pico. The Dragon Room. Why?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Listen to this. down the answering machine, presses play.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me and Taggert grabbed this from Ricky's apartment. See if you recognize this voice.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Times up, Ricky. The way I see it, me and you got a problem. Stone wants you and your friends dead and I want that money. So I'll make you a deal. If you ever wanna see that sweet young thing of yours again, you'll bring me the full ninety thousand.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Benson.

dialogues.speaker: BENSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'll tell Stone your dead, and we can all go our separate ways. Like this never happened. (beat) Dragon Room. Midnight. If you're one second late, the girl's dead.  94

dialogues.speaker: BENSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Ricky. I'm on your side. I hope you're not stupid. Axel hits stop on the machine.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What girl? Axel pulls the photo of Skylar and Ricky from his pants p

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: This girl. It's the same girl I saw at The Pit Stop. My guess...her and Ricky were both involved in stealing that money.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: He said the full ninety. That means her and Ricky took over a hundred gees. No wonder they're so pissed off. Axel stares at the still image of the dead young woman la the back alley.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: The bigger question is...who's this dead girl in the alley?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: She's an overdose. Her friends called in a 911 emergency. Supposedly, she just collapsed right there in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: What was the name of the girl who called this in?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Lisa, Linda, Layla. Something.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Lola? Rosewood suddenly realizes who it is. He slumps in his ch with a surprised look on his face. Axel seems annoyed as he quickly digs up Lola's photo.  95 He shoves it in Rosewood's face.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Is this her?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I never talked to her. She disappeared before I could question her.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Man, you guys still need me, don't you? Lola was killed because she knew something. She was either involved in this girl's death or tried to blow the whistle. Either way, they killed her for it. Another realization hits Rosewood.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: The redhead. Reena!

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Lola was too scared to come forward about Stone, so she sends her friend Reena instead. It's all coming together now.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm lost.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Rosewood took a statement from a girl about a bad cop. That was Reena. My guess is she was either there that night with Lola or decided to come forward to keep her friend in the clear. Rosewood checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: It's after nine. We got less than three hours before Ricky meets with Benson.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: That is, of course, if Ricky got the message. But it looks like Ricky's long gone.  96

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: We're talking ninety thousand dollars here. We should assume that Benson got in touch with him by now. If not at home, then on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: In the meantime, we got three hours to come up with a game plan. Otherwise, Ricky's a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: We're gonna need a car.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Mine's a two seater. Axel smiles. They all turn to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So did he fly to that medical conference or drive? Jenny laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spotless, shined up Cadillac Escalade parks in a red zo the front door and out steps Axel, Rosewood and Taggert. Axel is wearing a dark hoodie, a black leather racing jac shades as he pretends to be incognito. Rosewood and Tagge as bodyguards as they stare down the crowd waiting in lin The crowd turn and whisper to one another, point at Axel wonder who he is. The three men skip to the front of the line as a buff DOO is choosing who enters the club.  97

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Say, my man. Sorry I'm late. Traffic was a bitch. Excuse us. Axel snaps his fingers at Rosewood and Taggert and they f him toward the door like lapdogs. The Door Man lays his hand on Axel's chest, stops him.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: Hold it right there, flash. The line is that way. Points his beefy finger down the street.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Line? Ain't no line, cousin. I'm the entertainment. Mister Phan requested I be here no later than eleven thirty. It's eleven thirty five. We're supposed to be set up, ready to turn this mufucka out by midnight. So do me a favor and get your big monkey ass out my way before I gotta call Mister Phan and handle this, see?

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: You know what I think? I think you and The Oakridge Boys here ain't on the list. I think you're full of shit. So how bout you beat it before this big monkey turns you all into banana pudding.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Alright. You wanna do it the hard way? Fine. Axel removes his shades, drops his hoodie, and quickly fl his identification.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Axel Foley. Fire Marshall. (to Taggert) Would you frisk this man, please?

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: What is this?  98 Taggert approaches. The Door Man shoves him back. Rosewood flashes his holstered gun.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Sir, I suggest you cooperate or there's gonna be trouble. The Door Man slowly raises his arms as Taggert does a pat and discovers a small automatic pistol.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what this is about! This property just happens to be in violation of section PL90X and 867-5309 of the fire safety code! The Door Man squints with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't even get me started about the inside of this place! But you got people lined up down the streets blocking not one, not two, but three fuckin exits and a fire escape! The Door Man plays like he's checking down the street. He following along as he shakes his head with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I was gonna be a gentleman and come inside and give Mister Phan the opportunity to fix this! Instead, you chose to insult me and assault one of my marshalls! On top of this, you're carrying an unlicensed firearm! (to Rosewood) Mister Rosewood! Cuff this man!

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: Now hold on a second. I don't want any trouble. I'm just the door man. The crowd in line start to get ugly as they shout obsceni all four of the men.  99

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. I'm afraid you had your chance to cooperate, sir. (to Rosewood) Are you gonna cuff this man or do I have to do it? Rosewood continues toward him. The Door Man steps back.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: Hey, look. You wanna talk with Mister Phan, then go on. Alright? I just do what I'm told.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Rosewood. Back off. Rosewood backs away from him.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR MAN
dialogues.text: Can I go now?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, you can go. Get the hell outta here. Don't let me see you again. The Door Man jets as the rowdy crowd erupts. Axel and the head inside before they're trampled by the incoming clubb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel, Taggert and Rosewood move through a busy crowd, wal a Chinese Dragon Dance already in progress. The dragon zi its way through an array of glass table tops where clubbe seated. At each table, a torch is lit. The dancers move to the beat of the DRUMS as they glide a the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Phan and Stone watch Axel, Taggert and Rosewood fro two-way office window.  100

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And here they are. Right on time.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I wouldn't start celebrating just yet. It's quarter to and still no sign of the kid. Harry turns to him. A growing smile.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't worry. He'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel, Taggert and Rosewood take a seat at one of the glas tops. Axel scans the floor for any signs of Ricky or Skyl he spots -- SKYLAR picking up a drink order at the bar. She turns and Axel. A smile.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Axel. Isn't that her?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I see her. You guys hang back. Axel pats Rosewood on the chest as he heads for the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: Axel hurries to catch up with Skylar, who carries her tra corner booth. He grabs her by the arm as she turns to him A smile.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Look who it is. I guess you changed your mind. Axel flashes the photo of her and Ricky together.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You wanna explain this? Skylar checks the photo. She doesn't follow.  101

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: He's a friend. So what?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So we need to find a place to talk. Like, right now. Axel grabs her by the arm and drags her into a corner.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Hey, you don't need to do that. You wanna talk, we'll talk. Skylar turns her attention to a long, mirrored wall in th corner of the room. She sets down her tray of drinks, gra Axel by the arm and walks him toward the wall. There's a small slit in the glass as Skylar uses an ID CA is chained to her skirt to open up the private room. The mirrored wall opens up as Skylar and Axel head inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skylar shoves Axel into a leather chair as she hops on hi and starts an erotic lap dance.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: There. Now isn't that better?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: We don't have much time. He'll be here any second.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Look man. There's cameras all over this place. If you don't want me to get in trouble, then act like you're enjoying this.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened at The Pit Stop.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Axel grabs her, makes her stop.  102

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Then that must've been some other girl Benson was talkin' about killing if Ricky don't show with that money by midnight. Skylar sits in shock.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, do I have your attention now? Skylar huffs in frustration. She comes around.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Look, I let him crib at my place, but I'm not involved in any of this. I even told him and Ginny they were nuts for going through with it.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Ginny. Who's Ginny? An exit door in the far corner opens and in walks --

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: with a back pack full of money. Ninety grand. He and Axel eyes, both surprised to see each other. A sudden realization hits Axel like a sack of bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GUNMEN lock and load their machine guns and take aim glass wall. One of them is Benson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel shoves Skylar and himself to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (to Ricky) Get down! The glass wall is RIDDLED WITH AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE as Ricky with several shots. He falls to the ground. Dead.  103 The bag of money also falls limp to the floor. As the glass wall explodes and breaks into large shards o carpet, Axel raises his gun and FIRES MULTIPLE SHOTS. One of the men is struck in the shoulder and chest and fa the floor. Benson escapes down the hall. Axel checks on Skylar.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: No, are you crazy? Axel checks on Ricky. Now dead. In runs Taggert and Rosewood, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Axel!

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Never mind that! Take the girl and get her outta here! Fast! Axel chases down the hall after Benson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel fights his way through a busy crowd as they gather n back room bar and congregate on a tall staircase overlook dance floor. Axel spots Benson at the top of the steps, making his way the roof.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Axel pushes and shoves his way up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benson pushes a circle of friends having some wine out of way - runs to a steel railing at the edge of the roof. A full view of the street. He's run out of places to hide Axel makes his way onto the roof as Benson spots him. Ben raises his gun in the air and FIRES A FEW SHOTS. The panicked crowd almost runs over Axel as they head for stairs. They knock his gun to the ground. One of the clubbers plays hero and attempts to grab Benso from his raised arm. During the scuffle, Benson drops his gun and punches the the mouth. Axel jumps him as the two almost fall over the railing. B grabs Axel's throat, chokes him as Axel digs his thumb in throat. Benson releases him as the two men gasp for air. Axel thr hard right hook and knocks Benson --

dialogues.speaker: OFF THE ROOF
dialogues.text: and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benson falls through the glass and onto a lighted DANCE F where clubbers SCREAM and run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLIGHT
dialogues.text: Axel's face appears over the railing as he stares down at dead cop on the dance floor. His BLOOD spills out in gush

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel is out of gas, drops to his knees.  105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skylar sits on a couch, shaking. Her nerves are shot. Axe the others hover over her, pump her for questions. Jenny enters with a cup of coffee. She hands it to Skylar takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You're awful lucky you didn't get all of us killed back there.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: They were gonna kill me! What would you do?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: They were gonna kill you anyways. You set us up.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You said Ricky and Ginny took that money. Who's Ginny? Axel grabs a photo of the dead girl in the alley from Ros Shoves it in Skylar's face.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this Ginny? Skylar is quiet at first, but comes around.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Ginny worked at The Dragon Room as a waitress.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: A waitress? You mean an escort.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Congratulations, cop.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'm not a cop.  106 This is news to Taggert and Rosewood as they share a conf look. Axel showes Skylar a photo of Lola Marcus. Skylar is

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was hired to find this girl by her father.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: You know her, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Yes. She also worked at the club as a dancer. Her name's Lola. I don't know what happened to her. I haven't seen her in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Tell me what happened to Ginny. She didn't die of natural causes. Phan had her killed and I wanna know why. Did they find out her and Ricky stole that money?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: A few weeks back, Ricky tells me this cop Eddie Stone was working for Phan. He said this other cop found out he was on Phan's payroll and opened an investigation on him.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: What was his name? This cop?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: I don't know. All I know is Stone supposedly sent Ginny to get her hooks into this cop. Get him all hot and bothered and bring him back to The Pit Stop for a quick roll.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Why? shocked by his stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: Whatta you mean why? They wanted to catch him on tape. Use it as blackmail.  107

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: So they killed her to cover their tracks?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: No. Ginny got greedy. Her and Ricky came up with this plan. They burned a copy of the blackmail video of her and this cop, then played both sides. Taking money from Stone and the other cop at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Weinberg. Taggert and Axel turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Weinberg. He's IA. No wonder he's been putting up so much resistance. He's been working under the table for Stone this whole time. Rosewood paces the floor. Flustered. He's been played for fool by Weinberg.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: (to Skylar) How was Lola involved in all this?

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: They sent Lola to spike Ginny's drink. She didn't know they were gonna kill her. She was supposed to just walk her to her car and drive her home. When she collapsed in the alley, Lola freaked out and called the cops.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So that's why she split town. She was afraid the cops would find out she killed her.  108

dialogues.speaker: SKYLAR
dialogues.text: What's gonna happen to me now?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Nothing. You're gonna stay here for a couple days until we can figure this thing out. This is news to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: She is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STIGGS is busy kickboxing a punching bag in Phan's high t and the room is dark. A simple light illuminates this cor the room. A dark presence enters the gym and waits by the door. Sti stopped by the sound of a door creaking open, turns.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We have a problem. The almost black silhouette of Harry Phan steps closer in light as his face is fully revealed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Officer Benson is dead and our police friends have the girl. Stiggs ignores Harry, hits and kicks the bag as he moves tight circle.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It seems our involvement with Detective Stone has become more trouble than it's worth. I'm counting on you to take care of it. Stiggs finally stops, faces Harry, who offers nothing mor smile as he exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stone stares down at the back pack filled with ninety tho dollars in cash sitting on a pricey glass dining table. He is locked in on this money - focused. Stone rubs the s on his face in a nervous fit, paces the floor. Several pi luggage are packed and ready as they rest on the tile. Stone is shocked to see --

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: standing in a door frame, his gun aimed and ready to shoo

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Going somewhere, Stone?

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing in my house?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: If you think I'm going down alone, you're crazier than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: You have one other option. You can kill the girl, along with Rosewood and Foley.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: So, paint an even bigger target on my back while you're sitting on a beach with ninety grand? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: So you came here to take the money?

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: No. I came here to kill you and take the money.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: Not very smart. Killing a cop. You're in enough trouble as it is. The way I see it...you need me.  110

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: I need you? How?

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: To get Rosewood and Foley out of the picture. For good. Tonight. Stone cautiously steps closer to Weinberg, who gets nervo backs out of the dining room, into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: STONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your only other option is to run. And you won't get far. Not as long as they're alive. You know this.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Stay back. Stone forces him further into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: We're running out of time. If we're gonna do this, I need you to focus. No more games.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Weinberg pulls back the hammer on his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: I said get back.

dialogues.speaker: STONE
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. Without me, you're dead. Drop the gun. And from behind a wall jumps STIGGS with a hypodermic nee he jams it in Stone's neck. Stone collapses to the tile f as Weinberg lowers his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: There. You got him. Now give me the money. Stiggs cracks an evil smile as he nods toward the dining gives Weinberg the signal to grab the cash.  111 Weinberg hurries back into --

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: and snags the bag of money from the glass table. He check see if Stiggs is watching him and bolts for the front doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weinberg rushes to his car, jumps in with the bag of mone INT. WEINBERG'S CAR вЂ”- MORNING Weinberg sticks in his key. Not a click. Nothing. The car completely dead.

dialogues.speaker: WEINBERG
dialogues.text: Start, you sonofabitch! Weinberg spots Stiggs standing in front of his car. A MAC GUN aimed, locked and ready.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDSHIELD IS RIDDLED WITH AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE
dialogues.text: - as Weinberg is quickly killed. Stiggs cracks a toothy grin as he heads for the passenger door, grabs the money from the empty seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stone's unconscious body sits limp in an expensive reclin Stiggs places a FORTY FIVE in his lifeless hand. Stiggs is now wearing goggles and covered in a black tras material from head to toe. He holds the forty five to Sto temple, pulls the trigger. Pow! A bright CRIMSON RED sprays across a white leather couch marble coffee table.  112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Phan's Mercedes limo sits in an empty field overloo very scenic downtown Los Angeles. Harry leans on the hood, smokes a cigarette as Stiggs arr his car and parks some few feet away. Stiggs steps out with the bag full of ninety thousand in he slowly approaches.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: May I presume that Mister Stone is no longer? Stiggs nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. But Foley and Rosewood have become a bigger problem than I had first anticipated. One of Harry's soldiers steps out of the limo with anothe of cash. Harry takes it, unzips and flashes it to Stiggs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One hundred thousand. Harry zips it up, tosses it in the dirt in front of Stigg

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If Foley and Rosewood aren't dead by day's end...I'll have no choice but to assume you split with my money. And then I will kill you. Is this understood? Stiggs smiles, heads back to his car, throws the bag insi he steps in. Harry smiles as Stiggs drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stiggs exits a dirt road and enters the thin, two lane bl He picks up speed as he ventures off on his mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stiggs uses a free hand to unzip the bag of money, peeks and spots a stack of cash. He hears a slight TICKING unde pile of money. He pushes away what turns out to be a short stack of bill discovers a BOMB just three seconds from detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Stiggs car careens out of control -- BOOM! It explodes into a hundred pieces of flame and rubb BLAZING TIRE bounces over a bluff and down a hill. Phan's LIMO passes and a rear window lowers. And Harry sn quick look at his handy work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room sits half in the hotel, half on a sand dune over the beach, no walls or windows, just an open deck with Gr like pillars holding it all up. Every table in the room is filled with eager faces, all d to the nines, sipping momosas or having coffee. Harry Phan sits at a stretched table under a giant banner reads UTOPIA HOTEL AND SPA GRAND OPENING. Nick Thomopolis sits at a table up front, flashy suit and The gorgeous HOSTESS takes to the podium to welcome every coming. A tall, Chinese-American goddess in a thousand do gown with fake, oversized breasts.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: Welcome. And thank you for coming to the grand opening of the Utopia Hotel And Spa.  114 The crowd erupts with applause and cheers.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As a token of our appreciation for your support, you will find at your tables a one week complimentary pass for you and a guest. All expenses paid. The crowd all reach for a stack of cards at the center of respective tables as the room fills with excited chatter.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course...none of this would be possible if it weren't for one man. A man with a true vision. Please put your hands together for my husband...Mister Harry Phan. The room fills with deafening applause as Harry takes to podium, kisses his wife. Before he can utter his first word -- AXEL struts his way to the front, microphone in hand.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: That's right! The man of the hour! Mister Harry Phan! Give it up! I said give it up for Harry! Axel claps his palms together, causing some REVERB on the mic in his hand. The crowd all cover their ears.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, nobody's as excited to be here as I am. To be here...side by side with my friend Harry Phan. To celebrate this special day. I can tell he's just as excited to see me here. Harry shoots him the look of death.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at the look on his face. Priceless.  115

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As many of you already know...Harry has sacrificed a lot to be here. And faced just as many challenges along the way. Thomopolis shifts in his seat, covers up his face from vi Axel pats him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nick Thomopolis, ladies and gentlemen. From guns and drugs to hotels. Good to see you, Nick. Thomopolis gives a quick wave hello to the crowd as he bu his face in his hands. Axel paces the floor under the podium as Harry gives him thousand yard stare.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But one thing you need to know about Harry...is when he sets his mind to doing something, he don't let anything or anyone get in his way. Not the FBI, the IRS, not even a federal indictment can stop Harry from opening his hotel. The crowd all turn and stare, whisper to one another.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it's not just him that deserves the credit. As I look out here into this crowd...I see the many faces that have also sacrificed themselves and their time to fulfill Harry's dream. There are several tables up front filled with Harry's you and ladies. His вЂњsoldiersвЂќ.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most people would say fuck it. I can do this on my own, but not Harry. He says I don't care how we raise the money. Stand on the corner, sling drugs, prostitute yourself, it don't matter. (beat) All that matters is the vision.  116 A couple of Harry's Soldiers, dressed in white tuxedos, b the front of the room, eyes on Axel.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I see many faces here today, that have not only given themselves, but have sold their own bodies for this man, Mister Harry Phan. As the two soldiers draw closer, Harry warns them off wit and a simple wave of the hand. The two soldiers reluctantly back off but hold their grou stare back at Axel with a look that could kill.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You might know them. They may be sitting next to you right now. They may be your neighbors. They may even be your sons or daughters. You never know. Thomopolis quietly sneaks for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nick Thomopolis! He says congrats on the hotel, Harry, but kiss my ass and have a nice day. I'm out. Thomopolis jets for the beach, never looking back. Axel g him a nice round of applause as he pats his two palms tog and causes another wicked REVERB. The crowd all cover their ears.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I don't wanna steal the show. After all, this is Harry's special day. To tell you the truth, he don't have that much longer to truly appreciate the fruits of his labor with his upcoming trial, so I'm gonna leave and let him enjoy this little bit of time he has left in peace. So thank you, Harry. Enjoy your brunch. It's Miller time. Thank you. Axel drops the mic on the floor as the REVERB sends the r an uproar. He heads for the exit.  117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's limo casually cruises the palm tree dotted strip to the mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits in the back with a sour scowl on his face, sip scotch rocks as he reflects on his ruined grand opening. He peeks through the front windshield as the limo creeps steep hill and is surprised to see a POLICE ROADBLOCK sit dead center of the posh street.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mother-fucker. (to driver) Get us out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along with a couple dozen SQUAD CARS, marked and unmarked several UNIFORMED COPS, DETECTIVES, and Axel and Rosewood Rosewood smiles as he spots the limo creeping to a stop. also smiles as he struts down the street toward them. The limo cuts down a side street at high speed, SCREECHIN TIRES on the asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's limo tries its best to evade authorities but SCRE to a halt as FOUR SQUAD CARS block the street from both s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pulls his gun as he spots several UNIFORM COPS jump of their cars. He turns around, spots several more cars p up from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's limo is quickly surrounded with ARMED OFFICERS as draw down on the rear windshield and back passenger windo One officer forces out the DRIVER at gunpoint. Rosewood's Lexus arrives on the scene as Axel and Rosewoo out with beaming smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: Axel. It's done. Let them handle it. Axel walks to the limousine and signals the officers to b as he jumps in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Never mind. Fuck me. Rosewood shakes his head, gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axel sits across from a very upset Harry. The two are sil first as Axel sports a big, wide grin.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: So. Here we are. I never really had a chance to introduce myself. My name is Axel Foley. Axel pulls the photo of Lola from his coat pocket. Hands Harry.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that is Lola. She's the reason I got into this mess. Harry looks at the photo.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Pretty girl.  119

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: She was. She got killed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can tell you're real broken up about it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lola was special. Fresh. Not yet bruised by the ugliness of the world and so full of life and promise. I had high hopes for her. But, like so many others, she chose to throw it away. And for what? Peace of mind? Harry scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your police department pretends to care, yet thousands of young women just like her are still on the street and they do nothing. Harry leans in closer to Axel.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long do you think the Lola's of this world can last on their own? I gave her a home. I made a place for her. And for many like her. And your friends in the police chose to get her killed. Harry laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For what? So they can get the bad guy. No matter who dies in the process. (beat) You think I'm the problem? My friend, you're the problem. Axel plays interested as he slumps forward in his seat an his face in his hands in a mocking fashion.  120

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're the problem because you and all like you refuse to face your own greed. You see it as a cancer. Something dark and unholy. Lola knew who she was and what she wanted, and she went after it. And now she's dead for what? (laughs) Because she chose to do the right thing? Now don't you think if she had the chance to do it over again, she'd do things a bit differently? (serious) The hypocrisy of the police department is almost absurd. Axel takes a moment to soak it all up.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You know, I was a cop for twenty five years and I've come up against some real nasty bastards, but you... (beat) You're something special. Harry smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyways, I just wanted you to get a good look at my face. You know, so you can think of it every night when you're cryin' yourself to sleep in your prison cell and masturbating with your own tears and shit like that. Harry is seconds from pulling his gun on Axel as he grips pistol tighter and tighter.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do me a favor though. Just when you're gettin' ready to finish, think 'Axel Foley'. Every day you're gonna be saying to yourself 'I'm in here playin' with my own shit and never gonna get pussy again cos of Axel Foley'. That's what I want you to do.  121

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyways, I don't know if you noticed or not, but there's some cops outside waiting, so I'll let them to it. Take care of yourself. Axel steps out, but stops half way.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. One more thing. Harry waits for it.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Axel spits dead in his face. A smug smile on Harry's face slowly wipes it away.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's for Lola. Axel goes on his way, leaves Harry to himself as the offi quickly place him in custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRIGHT ORANGE SUNSET that started our story is back a slowly falling over the ocean's still horizon. Axel works the grill as he cooks up some dogs and burgers Jan sits in Rosewood's lap, feeds him fresh strawberries. They giggle like schoolkids while -- Jenny watches them, jelly faced, from a deck chair, a dri hand. She rolls her eyes. Johnny and Jordan soak their feet in the hot tub while Ta and retired Police Chief ANDREW BOGOMIL appear from insid a bottle of champagne. Taggert blows the cork. POP!

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: Okay. I never got the chance to properly toast my son and his beautiful bride.  122 Johnny and Jordan smile, share a tight hug.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Johnny. That means you. Get your ass over here. They all share a laugh. Johnny and Jordan join the others Bogomil helps pour and hand everyone a glass of champagne

dialogues.speaker: BOGOMIL
dialogues.text: Don't spill. This is the good stuff. I hear we have Axel to thank.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (curious) Hey. Where did you get that? Did you find that in the wine cellar?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter where we found it. The man's tryin' to give a toast. Let him have his moment.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT
dialogues.text: (to Johnny and Jordan) Here's to your never ending happiness and to new beginnings. Rosewood and Jan share a smile as she wipes some strawber his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Rosewood) To seeing old friends. And remembering what's really important. Rosewood tips his glass to Taggert, and then Axel. He als his glass to Jenny who cracks a grin.

dialogues.speaker: TAGGERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know none of us are promised forever. So I just wanted to be sure to say, just in case I never get the chance, that I love you. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Here here.  123 They all chug their glass in unison. Rosewood stands, joi hands with Jan as they join the group.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: I guess this would be as good a time as ever to share our news. Axel and the others brace themselves.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: You're pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: BOGOMIL
dialogues.text: Axel, please. (to Jan) You're not, are you? Jan smacks Axel on the chest as Rosewood laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: No. I think I'll stick with three, Dad, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: So anyways. Where was I?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. You were about to tell your Dad you guys were getting married. My fault.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Axel! Shit! Bogomil is overjoyed as he gives Rosewood a giant hug, an his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: BOGOMIL
dialogues.text: That's wonderful. Jenny joins them, gives Rosewood a quick hug and a kiss o cheek. She gives him an вЂњit's okayвЂќ look before huggi

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You have yourself a good man. Take care of him.  124 Jan wipes her tears as her and Rosewood embrace. Jordan is jelly faced as she shoots the remainder of her champagne. Johnny notices she's upset.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just that this was our moment. They're stealing our thunder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You're being silly. Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: JORDAN
dialogues.text: I'm not being silly. Axel sets his glass down and pulls Rosewood and Johnny aw the crowd, throws an arm around each of them.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Man, this is just too much. All of us together. Two of my favorite guys getting married. Tell you what. Today is your lucky day, cos yours truly is throwing his hat into the ring and unselfishly volunteering himself to throw the bomb bacherlor party to end all bachelor parties.

dialogues.speaker: ROSEWOOD
dialogues.text: (whispers) Axel. Not now. Jenny smiles, crosses her arms.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Axel...?

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: No, no, no. I know what you guys are thinking. It's not gonna be like that. We're talking a very boring, very straight-laced bachelor party with just the guys. Nothing but us guys.  125 Jan points her boney finger at Axel.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: No funny business. Johnny winks at Axel. Jordan shoots Johnny a nasty stare.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Nah. I'm just talkin' about a small get together with just the guys, that's all. Taggert and Bogomil share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BOGOMIL
dialogues.text: Why do I get the feeling there's more to this story.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL
dialogues.text: It just so happens that on the way over here I found the perfect place for you guys. It's nice and quiet. Absolutely no women around. No alcohol. Very dull and conservative. You're gonna love it. Taggert, Bogomil, Jenny, Jan and Jordan all give him an u look. He's full of it.

dialogues.speaker: AXEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trust me. Axel turns and stares INTO THE CAMERA as WE FREEZE FRAME face and trademark smile. FADE OUT.
